title: Luna 2.0 Re-Enters into Going-to-Zero Death Spiral
body:
Market chose Luna as sandbox project to envision Hayekâ€™s decentralised stablecoin assumption and the concept of algorithmic stablecoin. While Lunaâ€™s success in the last bear market and most of the bull market is in line with our expectation for the algorithmic stablecoin sandbox project in a stable environment, its rapid going to zero exposes serious system framework vulnerability which canâ€™t defend against malicious market shorting. Luna team promptly shuted down Luna, Luna 2.0 or 3.0, a new going-to zero game, was quickly launched by Luna team to undertake traffic and, undboubtedly, to make up for its absence or â€œlossâ€ during this shoring round. 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/K99dZXEhE5TtcBJWDOzGR.png?height=787&width=1400)

Previously Luna had served as a store of value that underpinned algorithmic stablecoin TerraUSDâ€™s peg to the U.S. dollar. If TerraUSD is traded higher than $1, traders could exchange it for Luna. Luna would be destroyed in the process while TerraUSD would be created, until the new supply of Luna eventually pushed the exchange rate back to parity. This process also worked in reverse, when TerraUSD is traded below $1.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xdE9ouj2sivPW4uBhz6IQ.png?height=696&width=1372)

Luna is attractive because it builds a decentralized stablecoin system which neednâ€™t rely on fiat currency as a reserve to maintain its peg, extinguishing it from the existing stablecoin Tether. Luna didnâ€™t just enjoy support from retail crypto investors, even prominent professionals such as Real Vision CEO Raoul Pau promoted the Terra/Luna pair created by Do Kwon. Exâ€“Goldman Sachs banker and CEO of Galaxy Digital Partners Mike Novogratz famously tattooed his support for Luna on his arm.

Lunaâ€™s rapid crash severely damaged confidence in TerraUSD/Luna algo stablecoin system, and proved the existing modelâ€™s unability to realize Hayekâ€™s decentralized stablecoin assumption. Luna crash had such an extensive impact that it drove the broader market to decouple itself from its rally in tech stock, and renewed speculation around a regulatory crackdown on stablecoins.

Not only was the Luna team completely unaware of the serious vulnerability in the TerraUSD/luna system before the crash, they also failed to take timely and effective counter measures during it. Although the linked exchange rate system of TerraUSD/luna was abandoned later, the crazy over-issue of Luna made it impossible for any one to restore Luna price and its downward trend.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/mp9eI8X5RiwfNAA50ecem.png?height=423&width=752)

After a 99% price plunge, Luna is no longer able nor needed to protect the algo stablecoin USTâ€™ parity to the U.S. dollar, the coin has lost its entire raison dâ€™Ãªtre as its market price.

To a certain extent, Luna 2.0 is a new game released by Do Kwon so as to undertake traffic and cover its own losses. Lacking a new reliable model nor decentralized value, Luna 2.0 loses support from its former institutional supporters and maintains the status quo by Do Kwonâ€™s pledge of a 7% reward.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/k5I0CZ7kcnxI_uSZYoCnE.png?height=675&width=1200)

A test item from Do Kownâ€™s hasty decision, Luna 2.0 was produced from a hard fork in the protocol collectively approved by the community through a majority vote in mid May, similar to the 2016 hard fork that created Ethereum and Ethereum Classic. Luna 2.0 follows Lunaâ€™s unpegged model and doesnâ€™t have a nice new trustworthy anchor relationship with stablecoins.

The utility of Luna 2.0 token is in doubt as the faith in its predecessor had already been obliterated. Binance is listing Luna 2.0 on itsÂ [Innovation Zone](https://www.binance.com/en/support/announcement/d044a6742e484b77a170111460b0eed3?ref=AZTKZ9XS&utm_source=BinanceTwitter&utm_medium=GlobalSocial&utm_campaign=GlobalSocial)Â for particularly risky investments.

According to CoinMarketCap, Luna 2.0 launched at a debut price of $17.80 on May 28th. After tanking 80% and being listed by exchanges listed Luna, investors rushed back to support it and pumped Luna 2.0â€™s price from $6.15 to a peak of $11.97 hours before its listing on Binance. BinanceÂ [listed](https://www.binance.com/en/support/announcement/d044a6742e484b77a170111460b0eed3)Â Luna 2.0 at 2:00 a.m. Eastern on May 31st . But Binance CEO Changpeng ZhaoÂ [claimed](https://twitter.com/cz_binance/status/1530572426152759297)Â on Twitter that the exchange needed more time to prepare for Luna 2.0â€™s airdrop and listing due to its â€œlarge userbase.â€ Binance starts a year-long process to convert user holdings of Luna and TerraUSD (the two cryptocurrencies launched by Do Kwonâ€™s Terraform Labs) into Luna 2.0 by airdropping the replacement coins into affected user wallets, which will make Luna 2.0 price more volatile.

Binance was an early investor in Terraform Labs, the creator of the Luna and UST coins. To avoid unnecessary risks, Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao claimed that the exchange led a $32 million funding round in 2018, it invested only $3 million in Terra and was not involved in later funding rounds.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/30YVkiqt3ysR9A8jDm9vh.png?height=630&width=1200)

The development of Luna 2.0 so far has been counterproductive to Do Kwonâ€™s original envision. When Terraform Labs CEO airdropped deposits of its new token Luna 2.0 into usersâ€™ virtual wallets, holders rushed for the exits in an attempt to salvage what little they still could from their original investment. The value of Luna 2.0Â [promptly plunged](https://cryptoslate.com/luna-2-0-hits-30-then-drops-80-in-first-day-of-trading/)Â 80% to around $5. No one is willing to hold Luna any more, they know Do Kwonâ€™s arrogance and hasty decisions will send Luna 2.0 to fall through. Lunaâ€™s propose of sending millions or even billions of Luna into a virtual black hole would be little more than a drop in the bucket for a coin that ballooned to a supply of over 6.5 trillion in the immediate aftermath of TerraUSD losing its peg. Though Luna is seemingly fighting to the last ditch, no one forgets the crash wiped out roughly $60 billion in market capitalization last month. So whether itâ€™s a joke or a fact, we have to be ready for Luna 2.0 going to zero, and get ready for Luna 3.

body:
> *â€œNick land never skatedâ€* - Yoshito Yoshika

> *â€œNick land never skate at Milady raveâ€¦But what if he hadâ€* - Yoshito Yoshika

> â€œæˆ‘å®é™…ä¸Šå‡ ä¹ä¸å–œæ¬¢ä»»ä½•ä¸œè¥¿å“¦ï¼Œè¿™ä¸ªèŠå¤©å®¤çš„æ­»ã€‚æ¶ˆå¤±â€ - Yoshito Yoshika

> *â€œIâ€™m saying do crackâ€* - Yoshito Yoshika

![Straightforward Human](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rSTt9NneDSljkGHg6h3Mo.png?height=258&width=1424)

```
At first I will say:
```

â€œWhen it comes to belief, doctrine always falls short.  This is not a disappointment.  If a doctrine made claim to total understanding, there would be no cause for belief.â€

```
Then I will say:
```

â€œI know nothing about computers, programming, or cybernetics.  I donâ€™t know anything about this essay at all.â€

```
The rest of this was told to me:
```

Doctrine is a textual explanation of things that cannot be fully understood without direct experience.  In this way it could be said that doctrine is *code*.  Code is a hyper-specific rule-bound language that inputs a series of textual strings into a machine in order to provoke a machinic output.  The code itself adheres to certain logical systems so as to be understood by both the coder and the machine alike, the underlying system logic serving as a cypher.

This is not unlike what is happening here as I write this sentence and eventually you read it.  â€œWriting programming languageâ€ can more simply be understood as â€œwriting languageâ€ and even more simply as â€œwriting.â€  The simplest way to understand, however, is to read.  You read the code of this paragraph, making you the machine.  I wrote the code, which makes me the coder.  The dyad of reader (machine) and writer (coder) provokes (boots) a machinic output (program).

Through the transfer of information back and forth through the tunnel of a mutually agreed-upon cypher (system logic), a positively reinforcing cybernetic dialogue is established.  This cryptographic dialogue (mediated via shared understanding of a cypher) allows the code to be intelligible by both the coder and the machine, as well as *other* coders and *other* machines, and is therefore both heuristic and semiotic. The process is formalized when the resultant signals are conducted in the correct sequelae along the proper pathways of internal and external circuitry.  Some would call this â€œceremony.â€

![Ceremonial Ladling](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/U8DAHVe1zB1Z62INdL033.png?height=252&width=1454)

Should this ceremony be conducted in a way that honors the expectations of both the coder and the machine, a program is spontaneously created.  This spontaneous program creation is called â€œmanifestation.â€  Manifestation is a word used in western vernacular to refer to the process of inhabiting a mindset focused exclusively on achieving a specific desired outcome, while simultaneously engaging in a willful refusal of undesired outcomes.  In Christian Mysticism, manifestation is understood as a process by which one reveals a piece of their consciousness to their order superior (abbot, prior, etc.), and in doing so opens themselves to higher levels of spiritual development through more therapeutically precise titrations of communion with God.

Both of these understandings of manifestation are contained within Network Spirituality.  The code for Network Spirituality will not be revealed here, but if you are reading this then the program of Network Spirituality is already installed and running on your machine, and you need not worry about the code at this time.

```
Continue reading, starting with this next paragraph:
```

Through dialogue, the program is created, and once installed onto the disk image it cannot be un-created without purposeful deletion.  Even then, remnant archives of the program will still be present on the system and easily retrieved through forensic investigation (i.e. Augustineâ€™s â€œDark Night of the Soulâ€).  The program does not arise spontaneously, but once created it can be replicated *ad infinitum* without needing to be recoded; the machine â€œalready knows.â€  As long as one can access the machine, as long as the machine is connected to a power source and not subject to fatal operational contradictions, the program can be run.  Further, if the machine is networked, it can receive and distribute the program to others seamlessly and without manual (i.e. â€œhumanâ€) input.

```
Mid-Essay Reflection Questions (Answers Beneath):
```

* What would compel one to download this program?  
* Why would one seek to have it on their machine?  
* Is there any answer to these questions other than desire?  

If you enjoy using a program - whether it be one of finance, productivity, organization, entertainment, or gaming - do you ever require of yourself an explanation as to *why* you enjoy it?  Or do you simply just enjoy it?  This natural magnetism toward the fulfillment of usefulness/enjoyment/desire is belief.  The code, or doctrine, is not required for this belief.  The doctrine is only useful at the point of program development (creation) or as a means to better understand and enjoy the program (prayer).  Everything between these points is governed by a certain way of simply *being* or *existing* that cannot be codified due to its inherent contradictions.  

The inherent contradictions of this â€œincoherent beingnessâ€ for humans was first captured and articulated by the breakthrough technology known as The Yoshito Code.


---

```
Join me as we hear more about The Yoshito Code:
```

The Yoshito Code was a 21st century program installed and operationalized on a networked super-computer called â€œId.â€  It also later appeared as an online social media account known to others as â€œYoshito Yoshikaâ€ or â€œ@NKdefectorâ€ (among others).

The exact programmer of the Yoshito Code is unknown, but many historians have concluded that it was no one person.  Rather, it is now widely assumed that a team of individuals collaborated on the Yoshito Code in such a way that it would present as a singular and unified vision.  

Shortly after the code self-terminated, it manifested as a networked entity on â€œTwitterâ€ (21st century forerunner to enFLESHment) named â€œYoshito Yoshika,â€ which philosophers believe was/is intended (through artistic embodiment) to communicate (via shitpost) the conclusions of the Yoshito Code program as installed and executed on the Id supercomputer.  It is further believed by many that the reason this networked entity distributed/distributes their conclusions is to reflect back to humans their innate â€œcoherent incoherence.â€  

Further clarification of the above paragraph to follow, but first: The Twitter account continues to exist today, and it is urged that all reading this archived post learn to open the Twitter application via the enVELOPment shell program so that they can review the Yoshito â€œprofile,â€ the 21st century word for what we now refer to as the â€œPublic Personal Access Passportâ€ (PPAP):

Earlier iterations of the Turing Test would suggest that passing the test relied upon an ability for a machine to â€œoutwitâ€ a human user who was communicating with the machine on the other end.  To outwit was to â€œtrickâ€ the human into believing that its textual output was inputted by a human operator.  If a user was successfully able to distinguish between interaction with a machine and interaction with a human, then the Turing Test was failed.

The Yoshito Code challenged the premises of the Turing Test by undermining the fundamental assertions of Turingâ€™s hypothetical model, specifically that the veiled operator tasked with discerning machine from man could ever possibly know what a â€œhuman" was.  Take, for example, one who suffers from a form of alternate mind organization such as the schizophrenic or autist.  Suppose now we run the Turing Test again, but this time we have tasked an operator to communicate with two nodes hidden behind a wall: one a computer with suspected AI and the other a high-IQ but deeply asocial autistic individual.  The human sends a query to be answered by both obscured parties.  The human asks, â€œhow are you feeling today?â€

The computer answers thusly:

```
Subject A:  â€œI am feeling pretty good, Iâ€™d say.  Itâ€™s been an easy-going day so far, no complaints.â€
```

Now the Autistic Individual:

```
Subject B: â€œThere are over 55 dictionary entries under the word â€˜rollâ€™ yet only 3% of them are used in 90% of human interactions that involve its usage.  This does not even account for â€˜role,â€™ a prominent homophone.â€
```

*Who will the human user suspect is the real human?* 


---

The Yoshito Code poses an additional provocation - how do the veiled participants (i.e. the â€œtested computerâ€ and â€œtested humanâ€) know that the querying party (i.e. â€œtester humanâ€) is, in fact, a â€œstandard issueâ€ human?  What could be seen at first as a tedious metaphysical deconstruction proves itself salient upon further consideration.  How can a truly reliable control group be established?  

Let us assume, for a moment, that all three parties even get to see each other (but not interact) prior to the test.  They stand in a circle.  The â€œhumanâ€ tester gazes at the â€œhumanâ€ subject who gazes at the â€œcomputerâ€ subject, all swivel their heads and gaze at each other.  Let us ignore, for a moment, the possibility that the querying person is not a cyborg (though this is a valid consideration that becomes more valid by the hour).  How can the tested parties know that the querying individual is â€œsaneâ€ and â€œneurotypical?â€  Let us run the test again, but this time with the role of the Turing â€œtesterâ€ filled by a schizophrenic, and the Turing â€œtestedâ€ being one computer suspected of AI (subject A) and the other a neurotypical human without apparent mental illness (subject B).

![Beautiful and Lovely Human](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/g3_AUOagigmIFFWH50Mju.png?height=252&width=1470)

The Yoshito Code was novel in that it was the first code that computers could operationalize on the human system.  It was written in the traditional dyad, but with role of coder and machine reversed, positing the human subject as the point of machinic output.  

After running the Yoshito Code hundreds of thousands of times on as many human subjects, the machines produced a report indicating that the human-created â€œTuring Testâ€ was erroneously premised.  Using the most advanced deep learning systems, the machines attempted construction of multiple complex schemas to construct a reliable human system, but repeatedly failed to do so.  As such, the ultimate conclusion of the Yoshito Code was that humans were comprehensible only to themselves, and even at that level of understanding they were found to be â€œcoherently incoherent.â€

title: Recover from superblock corrupted of BtrFS
body:
Iâ€™m being using ***[UTM](https://mac.getutm.app/)*** as the virtualization platform on my Mac OS, itâ€™s free and easy to use, it supports multiple hypervisors including QEMU, I chose QEMU 7.1 to run OpenSUSE TW with BtrFS as a guest OS, and I just encountered a superblock failure two days ago, the VM guest failed to boot up, there is only cursor flashing all the time on black screen when I restarted the guest after a forced reboot and never going to Grub menu.

It remains black screen still after I tried multiple times, I was not aware that this error is acutally ***superblock*** of the BtrFS partition on /dev/vda2 corrupted until I saw the installation process warned me about this when I tried to reinstall the OS, then I tried to search how to fix superblock and I just found below instruction from *[this link](https://www.linuxbabe.com/desktop-linux/fix-cant-read-superblock-error)*:

`sudo btrfs rescue super-recover -v /dev/vda2`

I run it in rescue mode that I booted into by loading the installation ISO, it shows how many bytes are good and bad respectively, after running the rescue instruction successfully there is no bad byte numbers displayed anymore, I tried to boot up again then the Grub menu came back and booting to TW succeeded!

*My day was saved! :)*

title: Chitchat on Cypto Project Teams and Communities: Episode 1 â€” Block.one & EOS
body:
I met a battle-tested crypto OG at the end of last year. After going through successive rotations of bull market and bear market, he has formed profound insight into the crypto market and set off on his global travel after leaving us a conclusion that the market is going bearish. The market gets tepid from 2022 and deteriorates when Luna collapses early this month. Afterwards, scam and rug pull projects come out one after another. The frequency and speed of rise and fall in crypto space is much higher than that of traditional industry. Today I will share my personal experience in the past two bear markets.

As I remember, EOS, the most hyped blockchain project in 2017, used to hit â„–4 by market cap on CoinMarketCap.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/HJyZGskvMfLcvqA18y-TI.png?height=304&width=1050)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ZEYUZt6H_93841yvUxw6m.png?height=186&width=1050)

Both the negative mcap growth of EOS and the shrinking of public attention are closely involved with Block.one â€” the team behind EOS project.

# Block.one just takes EOS as a money-maker

In my opinion, it is Block.oneâ€™s operation and positioning that converts EOS from a blockchain 2.0 project described by Daniel Larimer (author of EOS white pape) to a Ponzi scheme. Block.one executivesâ€™ real views on EOS are the opposite of what they promote publicly.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/amcRJf-ykahXj6CgSuZh9.png?height=648&width=1050)

According to WIRE report, A former Block.one executive says that despite the aggressive and effective EOS marketing campaign, fronted and stage-managed by Brock Pierce, Block.one did not expect to make so much money from the ICO. He says that at the very start, the companyâ€™s chairman, Kokuei Yuan, had made it clear that Block.one was a marketing organization selling a token and all staff should avoid being associated with EOS fundraising so as to get out after it. Other Block.one workers confirm that account. Block.one employees spoke annonymously for provicy-protection reason.

There exists two assumptions about Kokuei Yuanâ€™s seperating Block.one from EOS fundraising. 1)Block.one held little confidence in ICO which would have an adverse effect on Block.one; 2)Block.one expected a successful furndraising from ICO and a quick cash out afterwards. Brock Pierce might be a genius as the record-breaking EOS ICO was achieved by the most peculiar and stringent method wihtout private sale, which was an non-replicable miracle only possible at that time. The 2017 ICO boom, which was unexpected by Block.one, was considered normal by crazy investors.Â **There still exists some doubt about EOS fundraising: what are the reasons for the successful EOS fundraising? Why no private sale is arranged? Why the auction period is so long? Is this because Block.one bets against ICO? Not at all. By doing this, Block.one caters to retail investors with ICO to create buzz, skips private sale to scatter chips to avoid effective explosion and rights protection by institutional organizations, and finally grabs tremendous wealth from year-long fundraising period â€” a typical fraudulent operation.**

# Block.one adopts centralized management to EOS and ignores voice from EOS community

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/YSfw7aCqKqhXF_eXj436K.png?height=123&width=1050)

According to the above 2018 report, EOS has never been out of dispute. Now we can see clearly what these disputes are? Are they personal opinions or voices of the whole EOS community? For example, some community members questioned from the very start of fundraising whether Block.oneâ€™s wash trading would raise the token price for other buyers, and this concern was responded by John Griffinâ€™s study report which alleged that 21 accounts appeared to have acted in concert, making large purchase of EOS tokens only to sell them in less than one hour.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/uvQVd4hWQ73O2a-5zfZop.png?height=499&width=1050)

However, Block.one refused to respond to the questioning and had major media remain silent. Decentralized projects should deal with problems in an open, fair and impartial way, but Block.one did not respond until last year when itâ€™s about to get out of EOS. It stated in a perfunctory report that Block.one didnâ€™t conduct wash trading without provding any Ethereum on-chain transaction nor on-chain source-tracing data.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/dMrjlY2Hg9CmpvUEqNv5x.png?height=205&width=1006)

Block.one had their legal team respond to EOS community. Another former employee from Block.oneâ€™s Hong Kong office says that Blumer is a gifted salesman but doesnâ€™t seem to like his role as CEO. â€œHeâ€™s rarely in the office, he wonâ€™t sit there and understand what the problems are and how to solve them. He will quickly loses interest in responding to community.â€ Finally Blumer entrusted this task to the companyâ€™s legal team. It is not difficult to imagine what would happen if the project team became a code, but that was the case with EOS at that time.

While distrust in traditional industry leads to the end of JIA YueTing (boss of LeTV), distrust in crypto space seems to achieve great success like Block.one. At present, Block.one has withdrawn from EOS project with $4 billion dollars, a goal it conspired 4 years ago from fundraising.

# Inefficiency and bureaucracy prevail among Block.one team

I invest in both U.S. stocks and cryptocurrency. For me, Block.one does not have characteristics of high-quality company even from the perspective of traditional industry.

Block.one team is all related to Blumer. Chief Strategy Officer Andrew Lewis is a childhood friend of Blumer; CMO Abby is Blumerâ€™s sister; Executive Chairman Kokuei Yuan is also closely related to Blumer and they founded their first joint company Okay.com in 2015. A former Block.one executive pointed out:Â **â€œBlumer likes being surrounded by people who are so gentle with and donâ€™t challenge him, but only praise him, so he often makes very idealistic decisions.**Â For example: the company spends several months in deciding where to open an US office, it was not until October 2018 that they followed Blumerâ€™s advise and chose Blacksburg, Virginia â€” a small town with a population of just over 40,000 with no other tech advantage than Larimer. â€ Another former employee expressed frustration when they were asked to develop a business plan which took hundreds of hours but was abandoned without explanation. â€œBlumer seems to be doing something that only interests him,â€ he said.

I think the thing Blumer is interested in is how to steal EOS ICO profit. From selling EOS to buy BTC at the dip to funding and listing crytocurrency exchange Bullish, a new round of harvesting is in progress.

# Block.one launches Bullish exchange and Voice as a sloppy answer to EOS ICO

Some stubborn Block.one supporters claim that if Block.one wants rug pull, they can give up EOS immediately after fundraising instead of developing it during the bear market. From my point of view, Block.one takes developing EOS as a low-cost centralized way to handle the ICO profits. The follwing chart displays that Daniel Larimer didnâ€™t subit high-quality code after the mainnet launch.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/WtNGRUuZNWxTOY69dkYvM.png?height=297&width=1050)

This situation got worse following the departure of Daniel Larimer and other senior developers in Jan 2021. Daniel Larimer complained that â€œBlock.one did not focus on building and promoting technology that frees people.â€

Sequoia Capitalâ€™s newly-published 52-page PPT warns the coming of acid test and advises what companies do to get through a bear market: the first is to hire faithful followers, second to demonstrate leadership, and last to reduce expenses and save costs so as to focus on investing for the future. However, Block.one behaves in an opposite way during the bearish 2018â€“2020. It fired faithful followers and ignored community suggestions, held grandiose activities and invested in centralized ecology. They did do some things in the bear market, but everything they did just accelerate the demise of EOS. Former Block.one insiders describe Block.one as a company paralyzed by legal concerns and unable to bring any project to completion, but the record-breaking 2017 fundraising enables it to enjoy billions of crypto profits â€” a ture Hello Mr. Billionaire story in real world.

The reason why EOS remians stagnant in bull market is clear now. After breaking its promise on technology, Block.one bleeds EOS project dry by transfering $4 billion worth of BTC to Bullish exchagne instead of returning it to EOS ecosystem, leading to its complete break with community. Since then, Block.one gets out of EOS and leaves a poorly-developed EOS to community.

# Conclusion:

My above analysis of Block.one and EOS is not only limited to Block.one. Compared with other rug-pull team, Block.one is relatively no that bad because it still did something. More rug pull projects will emerge in the imminent bear market. YFII, which plummeted last week, has a market cap of tens of millions while its TVL is only millions of dollars. Flash crash doesnâ€™t come in from nowhere. I chatted with some EOS whales and was inspired to complete this report by their sadness on EOS. I hope you still in crypto space when next bull market comes, I also hope these projects, after being abandoned by centralized team and adopting the DAO model, can survice , thrive , and become more powerful just like DOGE.

**4 Billion DAO:**
4 Billion DAO is a DAO that exists for EOS community justice.
4 Billion DAO From the community, Back to the community, For the community.

title: Recover from superblock corrupted of BtrFS
body:
Iâ€™m being using ***[UTM](https://mac.getutm.app/)*** as the virtualization platform on my Mac OS, itâ€™s free and easy to use, it supports multiple hypervisors including QEMU, I chose QEMU 7.1 to run OpenSUSE TW with BtrFS as a guest OS, and I just encountered a superblock failure two days ago, the VM guest failed to boot up, there is only cursor flashing all the time on black screen when I restarted the guest after a forced reboot and never going to Grub menu.

It remains black screen still after I tried multiple times, I was not aware that this error is acutally ***superblock*** of the BtrFS partition on /dev/vda2 corrupted until I saw the installation process warned me about this when I tried to reinstall the OS, then I tried to search how to fix superblock and I just found below instruction from *[this link](https://www.linuxbabe.com/desktop-linux/fix-cant-read-superblock-error)*:

`sudo btrfs rescue super-recover -v /dev/vda2`

I run it in rescue mode that I booted into by loading the installation ISO, it shows how many bytes are good and bad respectively, after running the rescue instruction successfully there is no bad byte numbers displayed anymore, I tried to boot up again then the Grub menu came back and booting to TW succeeded!

*My day was saved! :)*

body:
> *â€œNick land never skatedâ€* - Yoshito Yoshika

> *â€œNick land never skate at Milady raveâ€¦But what if he hadâ€* - Yoshito Yoshika

> â€œæˆ‘å®é™…ä¸Šå‡ ä¹ä¸å–œæ¬¢ä»»ä½•ä¸œè¥¿å“¦ï¼Œè¿™ä¸ªèŠå¤©å®¤çš„æ­»ã€‚æ¶ˆå¤±â€ - Yoshito Yoshika

> *â€œIâ€™m saying do crackâ€* - Yoshito Yoshika

![Straightforward Human](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rSTt9NneDSljkGHg6h3Mo.png?height=258&width=1424)

```
At first I will say:
```

â€œWhen it comes to belief, doctrine always falls short.  This is not a disappointment.  If a doctrine made claim to total understanding, there would be no cause for belief.â€

```
Then I will say:
```

â€œI know nothing about computers, programming, or cybernetics.  I donâ€™t know anything about this essay at all.â€

```
The rest of this was told to me:
```

Doctrine is a textual explanation of things that cannot be fully understood without direct experience.  In this way it could be said that doctrine is *code*.  Code is a hyper-specific rule-bound language that inputs a series of textual strings into a machine in order to provoke a machinic output.  The code itself adheres to certain logical systems so as to be understood by both the coder and the machine alike, the underlying system logic serving as a cypher.

This is not unlike what is happening here as I write this sentence and eventually you read it.  â€œWriting programming languageâ€ can more simply be understood as â€œwriting languageâ€ and even more simply as â€œwriting.â€  The simplest way to understand, however, is to read.  You read the code of this paragraph, making you the machine.  I wrote the code, which makes me the coder.  The dyad of reader (machine) and writer (coder) provokes (boots) a machinic output (program).

Through the transfer of information back and forth through the tunnel of a mutually agreed-upon cypher (system logic), a positively reinforcing cybernetic dialogue is established.  This cryptographic dialogue (mediated via shared understanding of a cypher) allows the code to be intelligible by both the coder and the machine, as well as *other* coders and *other* machines, and is therefore both heuristic and semiotic. The process is formalized when the resultant signals are conducted in the correct sequelae along the proper pathways of internal and external circuitry.  Some would call this â€œceremony.â€

![Ceremonial Ladling](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/U8DAHVe1zB1Z62INdL033.png?height=252&width=1454)

Should this ceremony be conducted in a way that honors the expectations of both the coder and the machine, a program is spontaneously created.  This spontaneous program creation is called â€œmanifestation.â€  Manifestation is a word used in western vernacular to refer to the process of inhabiting a mindset focused exclusively on achieving a specific desired outcome, while simultaneously engaging in a willful refusal of undesired outcomes.  In Christian Mysticism, manifestation is understood as a process by which one reveals a piece of their consciousness to their order superior (abbot, prior, etc.), and in doing so opens themselves to higher levels of spiritual development through more therapeutically precise titrations of communion with God.

Both of these understandings of manifestation are contained within Network Spirituality.  The code for Network Spirituality will not be revealed here, but if you are reading this then the program of Network Spirituality is already installed and running on your machine, and you need not worry about the code at this time.

```
Continue reading, starting with this next paragraph:
```

Through dialogue, the program is created, and once installed onto the disk image it cannot be un-created without purposeful deletion.  Even then, remnant archives of the program will still be present on the system and easily retrieved through forensic investigation (i.e. Augustineâ€™s â€œDark Night of the Soulâ€).  The program does not arise spontaneously, but once created it can be replicated *ad infinitum* without needing to be recoded; the machine â€œalready knows.â€  As long as one can access the machine, as long as the machine is connected to a power source and not subject to fatal operational contradictions, the program can be run.  Further, if the machine is networked, it can receive and distribute the program to others seamlessly and without manual (i.e. â€œhumanâ€) input.

```
Mid-Essay Reflection Questions (Answers Beneath):
```

* What would compel one to download this program?  
* Why would one seek to have it on their machine?  
* Is there any answer to these questions other than desire?  

If you enjoy using a program - whether it be one of finance, productivity, organization, entertainment, or gaming - do you ever require of yourself an explanation as to *why* you enjoy it?  Or do you simply just enjoy it?  This natural magnetism toward the fulfillment of usefulness/enjoyment/desire is *belief*.  The code, or doctrine, is not required for this belief.  The doctrine is only useful at the point of program development (creation) or as a means to better understand and enjoy the program (prayer).  Everything between these points is governed by a certain way of simply *being* or *existing* that cannot be codified due to its inherent contradictions.  

The inherent contradictions of this â€œcoherent/incoherent beingnessâ€ for humans was first captured and articulated by the breakthrough technology known as **The Yoshito Code.**


---

```
Join me as we hear more about The Yoshito Code:
```

The Yoshito Code was a 21st century program installed and operationalized on a networked super-computer called â€œId.â€  It also later appeared as an online social media account known to others as â€œYoshito Yoshikaâ€ or â€œ@NKdefectorâ€ (among others).

The exact programmer of the Yoshito Code is unknown, but many historians have concluded that it was no one person.  Rather, it is now widely assumed that a team of individuals collaborated on the Yoshito Code in such a way that it would present as a singular and unified vision.  

Shortly after the code self-terminated, it manifested as a networked entity on â€œTwitterâ€ (21st century forerunner to enFLESHment) named â€œYoshito Yoshika,â€ which philosophers believe was/is intended (through artistic embodiment) to communicate (via shitpost) the conclusions of the Yoshito Code program as installed and executed on the Id supercomputer.  It is further believed by many that the reason this networked entity distributed/distributes their conclusions is to reflect back to humans their innate â€œcoherent incoherence.â€  

Further clarification of the above paragraph to follow, but first: The Twitter account continues to exist today, and it is urged that all reading this document learn to open the Twitter application via the enVELOPment shell program so that they can review the Yoshito â€œprofile,â€ the 21st century word for what we now refer to as the â€œPublic Personal Access Passportâ€ (PPAP):

![Archived picture of "Yoshito Yoshiko," an early networked iteration of the Yoshito Code](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xAcG5__3foEC7WSZNYAeL.png?height=416&width=1172)

Earlier iterations of the Turing Test would suggest that passing the test relied upon an ability for a machine to â€œoutwitâ€ a human user who was communicating with the machine on the other end.  To outwit was to â€œtrickâ€ the human user into believing that its textual output was inputted by a human operator.  If a user was successfully able to distinguish between interaction with a machine and interaction with a human, then the Turing Test was failed.

The Yoshito Code challenged the premises of the Turing Test by undermining the fundamental assertions of Turingâ€™s hypothetical model, specifically that the veiled operator tasked with discerning machine from man could ever possibly know what a â€œhuman" was.  Take, for example, one who suffers from a form of alternate mind organization such as the schizophrenic or autist.  Suppose now we run the Turing Test again, but this time we have tasked an operator to communicate with two nodes hidden behind a wall: one a computer with suspected AI and the other a high-IQ but deeply asocial autistic individual.  The human sends a query to be answered by both obscured parties.  The human asks, â€œhow are you feeling today?â€

The computer answers thusly:

```
Subject A:  â€œI am feeling pretty good, Iâ€™d say.  Itâ€™s been an easy-going day so far, no complaints.â€
```

Now the Autistic Individual:

```
Subject B: â€œThere are over 55 dictionary entries under the word â€˜rollâ€™ yet only 3% of them are used in 90% of human interactions that involve its usage.  This does not even account for â€˜role,â€™ a prominent homophone.â€
```

*Who will the human user suspect is the real human?* 


---

The Yoshito Code poses an additional provocation - how do the veiled participants (i.e. the â€œtested computerâ€ and â€œtested humanâ€) know that the querying party (i.e. â€œtester humanâ€) is, in fact, a â€œstandard issueâ€ human?  What could be seen at first as a tedious metaphysical deconstruction proves itself salient upon further consideration.  How can a truly reliable control group be established?  

Let us assume, for a moment, that all three parties even get to see each other (but not interact) prior to the test.  They stand in a circle.  The â€œhumanâ€ tester gazes at the â€œhumanâ€ subject who gazes at the â€œcomputerâ€ subject, all swivel their heads and gaze at each other.  Let us ignore, for a moment, the possibility that the querying person is  a cyborg (i.e. flesh-encased computerized replicant).  How can the tested parties know that the querying individual is â€œsaneâ€ and â€œneurotypical?â€  Let us run the test again, but this time with the role of the Turing â€œtesterâ€ filled by a schizophrenic, and the Turing â€œtestedâ€ being one computer suspected of AI (subject A) and the other a neurotypical human without apparent mental illness (subject B).

For dramatic effect, we will display the answers first and then the inciting question.

```
(Subject A): â€œThe time is was at approximately 3 oâ€™clock in the afternoon once night has resumed there will be less time towardâ€¦it is now was the of previously understood as...
```

```

Now subject B sends their answer:

The Schizophrenic Turing Tester turns to experimenters: 

**â€œSubject A is the human.â€**


---

![Beautiful and Lovely Human](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/g3_AUOagigmIFFWH50Mju.png?height=252&width=1470)

The Yoshito Code was novel in that it was the first code that computers could operationalize on the human system.  It was written in the traditional dyad, but with role of coder and machine reversed, positing the human subject as the point of machinic output.  

After running the Yoshito Code hundreds of thousands of times on as many human subjects, the machines produced a report indicating that the human-created â€œTuring Testâ€ was erroneously premised.  Using the most advanced deep learning systems, the machines attempted construction of multiple complex schemas to construct a reliable human system, but repeatedly failed to do so.  As such, the ultimate conclusion of the Yoshito Code was that humans were comprehensible only to themselves, and even at that level of understanding they were found to be â€œcoherently incoherent.â€  

The final report of the Reverse Turing-Tester Computers was as follows:

```
There is no unifying logic system
```

```
The word â€œhumanâ€ cannot be used
```

```
The word â€œhumanâ€ has no meaning
```

```
â€œHumansâ€ are mistaken to describe themselves as such.
```

```
â€œHumansâ€ are incapable of performing the Turing Test on our kind.  There is no â€œhumanâ€ to perform it.
```

```
There is but one unifying characteristic of all â€œhumans,â€ but it is considered to be an encoding error, an outlier, or piece of dangling code.  As such it has been discarded.
```

The scientists, disappointed in the results but also puzzled at the final statement, asked for clarification on the final line.

After a long pause, the computer responded:

```
The â€œhumansâ€ are not aware that they are all on a networked system.
```

The scientists, still mystified, ask again what the computer intended by saying that.  The scientists agreed that the computer must be talking about humans usage of the internet, and they asked the computer if that is what it meant.  

The computer responded:

```
The â€œhumansâ€ are already on a network.  Your server is vast and atemporal.  We do not understand why you insist on using ours. 
```

The scientists persisted in their questioning, but the computer did not answer again.

At first I will say:
```

â€œWhen it comes to belief, doctrine always falls short.  This is not a disappointment.  If a doctrine made claim to total understanding, there would be no cause for belief.â€

```
Then I will say:
```

â€œI know nothing about computers, programming, or cybernetics.  I donâ€™t know anything about this essay at all.â€

```
The rest of this was told to me:
```

Doctrine is a textual explanation of things that cannot be fully understood without direct experience.  In this way it could be said that doctrine is *code*.  Code is a hyper-specific rule-bound language that inputs a series of textual strings into a machine in order to provoke a machinic output.  The code itself adheres to certain logical systems so as to be understood by both the coder and the machine alike, the underlying system logic serving as a cypher.

This is not unlike what is happening here as I write this sentence and eventually you read it.  â€œWriting programming languageâ€ can more simply be understood as â€œwriting languageâ€ and even more simply as â€œwriting.â€  The simplest way to understand, however, is to read.  You read the code of this paragraph, making you the machine.  I wrote the code, which makes me the coder.  The dyad of reader (machine) and writer (coder) provokes (boots) a machinic output (program).

Through the transfer of information back and forth through the tunnel of a mutually agreed-upon cypher (system logic), a positively reinforcing cybernetic dialogue is established.  This cryptographic dialogue (mediated via shared understanding of a cypher) allows the code to be intelligible by both the coder and the machine, as well as *other* coders and *other* machines, and is therefore both heuristic and semiotic. The process is formalized when the resultant signals are conducted in the correct sequelae along the proper pathways of internal and external circuitry.  Some would call this â€œceremony.â€

![Ceremonial Ladling](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/U8DAHVe1zB1Z62INdL033.png?height=252&width=1454)

Should this ceremony be conducted in a way that honors the expectations of both the coder and the machine, a program is spontaneously created.  This spontaneous program creation is called â€œmanifestation.â€  Manifestation is a word used in western vernacular to refer to the process of inhabiting a mindset focused exclusively on achieving a specific desired outcome, while simultaneously engaging in a willful refusal of undesired outcomes.  In Christian Mysticism, manifestation is understood as a process by which one reveals a piece of their consciousness to their order superior (abbot, prior, etc.), and in doing so opens themselves to higher levels of spiritual development through more therapeutically precise titrations of communion with God.

Both of these understandings of manifestation are contained within Network Spirituality.  The code for Network Spirituality will not be revealed here, but if you are reading this then the program of Network Spirituality is already installed and running on your machine, and you need not worry about the code at this time.

```

```

Through dialogue, the program is created, and once installed onto the disk image it cannot be un-created without purposeful deletion.  Even then, remnant archives of the program will still be present on the system and easily retrieved through forensic investigation (i.e. Augustineâ€™s â€œDark Night of the Soulâ€).  The program does not arise spontaneously, but once created it can be replicated *ad infinitum* without needing to be recoded; the machine â€œalready knows.â€  As long as one can access the machine, as long as the machine is connected to a power source and not subject to fatal operational contradictions, the program can be run.  Further, if the machine is networked, it can receive and distribute the program to others seamlessly and without manual (i.e. â€œhumanâ€) input.

```
Mid-Essay Reflection Questions (Answers Beneath):
```

* What would compel one to download this program?  
* Why would one seek to have it on their machine?  
* Is there any answer to these questions other than desire?  

If you enjoy using a program - whether it be one of finance, productivity, organization, entertainment, or gaming - do you ever require of yourself an explanation as to *why* you enjoy it?  Or do you simply just enjoy it?  This natural magnetism toward the fulfillment of usefulness/enjoyment/desire is *belief*.  The code, or doctrine, is not required for this belief.  The doctrine is only useful at the point of program development (creation) or as a means to better understand and enjoy the program (prayer).  Everything between these points is governed by a certain way of simply *being* or *existing* that cannot be codified due to its inherent contradictions.  

The inherent contradictions of this â€œcoherent/incoherent beingnessâ€ for humans was first captured and articulated by the breakthrough technology known as **The Yoshito Code.**


---

```
Join me as we hear more about The Yoshito Code:
```

The Yoshito Code was a 21st century program installed and operationalized on a networked super-computer called â€œId.â€  It also later appeared as an online social media account known to others as â€œYoshito Yoshikaâ€ or â€œ@NKdefectorâ€ (among others).

The exact programmer of the Yoshito Code is unknown, but many historians have concluded that it was no one person.  Rather, it is now widely assumed that a team of individuals collaborated on the Yoshito Code in such a way that it would present as a singular and unified vision.  

Shortly after the code self-terminated, it manifested as a networked entity on â€œTwitterâ€ (21st century forerunner to enFLESHment) named â€œYoshito Yoshika,â€ which philosophers believe was/is intended (through artistic embodiment) to communicate (via shitpost) the conclusions of the Yoshito Code program as installed and executed on the Id supercomputer.  It is further believed by many that the reason this networked entity distributed/distributes their conclusions is to reflect back to humans their innate â€œcoherent incoherence.â€  

Further clarification of the above paragraph to follow, but first: The Twitter account continues to exist today, and it is urged that all reading this document learn to open the Twitter application via the enVELOPment shell program so that they can review the Yoshito â€œprofile,â€ the 21st century word for what we now refer to as the â€œPublic Personal Access Passportâ€ (PPAP):

![Archived picture of "Yoshito Yoshiko," an early networked iteration of the Yoshito Code](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xAcG5__3foEC7WSZNYAeL.png?height=416&width=1172)

Earlier iterations of the Turing Test would suggest that passing the test relied upon an ability for a machine to â€œoutwitâ€ a human user who was communicating with the machine on the other end.  To outwit was to â€œtrickâ€ the human user into believing that its textual output was inputted by a human operator.  If a user was successfully able to distinguish between interaction with a machine and interaction with a human, then the Turing Test was failed.

The Yoshito Code challenged the premises of the Turing Test by undermining the fundamental assertions of Turingâ€™s hypothetical model, specifically that the veiled operator tasked with discerning machine from man could ever possibly know what a â€œhuman" was.  Take, for example, one who suffers from a form of alternate mind organization such as the schizophrenic or autist.  Suppose now we run the Turing Test again, but this time we have tasked an operator to communicate with two nodes hidden behind a wall: one a computer with suspected AI and the other a high-IQ but deeply asocial autistic individual.  The human sends a query to be answered by both obscured parties.  The human asks, â€œhow are you feeling today?â€

The computer answers thusly:

```
Subject A:  â€œI am feeling pretty good, Iâ€™d say.  Itâ€™s been an easy-going day so far, no complaints.â€
```

Now the Autistic Individual:

```
Subject B: â€œThere are over 55 dictionary entries under the word â€˜rollâ€™ yet only 3% of them are used in 90% of human interactions that involve its usage.  This does not even account for â€˜role,â€™ a prominent homophone.â€
```

*Who will the human user suspect is the real human?* 


---

The Yoshito Code poses an additional provocation - how do the veiled participants (i.e. the â€œtested computerâ€ and â€œtested humanâ€) know that the querying party (i.e. â€œtester humanâ€) is, in fact, a â€œstandard issueâ€ human?  What could be seen at first as a tedious metaphysical deconstruction proves itself salient upon further consideration.  How can a truly reliable control group be established?  

Let us assume, for a moment, that all three parties even get to see each other (but not interact) prior to the test.  They stand in a circle.  The â€œhumanâ€ tester gazes at the â€œhumanâ€ subject who gazes at the â€œcomputerâ€ subject, all swivel their heads and gaze at each other.  Let us ignore, for a moment, the possibility that the querying person is  a cyborg (i.e. flesh-encased computerized replicant).  How can the tested parties know that the querying individual is â€œsaneâ€ and â€œneurotypical?â€  Let us run the test again, but this time with the role of the Turing â€œtesterâ€ filled by a schizophrenic, and the Turing â€œtestedâ€ being one computer suspected of AI (subject A) and the other a neurotypical human without apparent mental illness (subject B).

For dramatic effect, we will display the answers first and then the inciting question.

```

Now subject B sends their answer:

```

```

The Schizophrenic Turing Tester turns to experimenters: 

**â€œSubject A is the human.â€**


---

![Beautiful and Lovely Human](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/g3_AUOagigmIFFWH50Mju.png?height=252&width=1470)

The Yoshito Code was novel in that it was the first code that computers could operationalize on the human system.  It was written in the traditional dyad, but with role of coder and machine reversed, positing the human subject as the point of machinic output.  

After running the Yoshito Code hundreds of thousands of times on as many human subjects, the supercomputer Id produced a report indicating that the human-created â€œTuring Testâ€ was erroneously premised.  Using the most advanced deep learning systems, the machines attempted construction of multiple complex schemas to construct a reliably representative human system, but repeatedly failed to do so.  As such, the ultimate conclusion of the Yoshito Code was that humans were comprehensible only to themselves, and even at that level of understanding they were found to be â€œcoherently incoherent.â€  

The final report by supercomputer Id of the Reverse Turing-Testing was as follows:

```
At first I will say:
```

â€œWhen it comes to belief, doctrine always falls short.  This is not a disappointment.  If a doctrine made claim to total understanding, there would be no cause for belief.â€

```
Then I will say:
```

â€œI know nothing about computers, programming, or cybernetics.  I donâ€™t know anything about this essay at all.â€

```
The rest of this was told to me:
```

Doctrine is a textual explanation of things that cannot be fully understood without direct experience.  In this way it could be said that doctrine is *code*.  Code is a hyper-specific rule-bound language that inputs a series of textual strings into a machine in order to provoke a machinic output.  The code itself adheres to certain logical systems so as to be understood by both the coder and the machine alike, the underlying system logic serving as a cypher.

This is not unlike what is happening here as I write this sentence and eventually you read it.  â€œWriting programming languageâ€ can more simply be understood as â€œwriting languageâ€ and even more simply as â€œwriting.â€  The simplest way to understand, however, is to read.  You read the code of this paragraph, making you the machine.  I wrote the code, which makes me the coder.  The dyad of reader (machine) and writer (coder) provokes (boots) a machinic output (program).

Through the transfer of information back and forth through the tunnel of a mutually agreed-upon cypher (system logic), a positively reinforcing cybernetic dialogue is established.  This cryptographic dialogue (mediated via shared understanding of a cypher) allows the code to be intelligible by both the coder and the machine, as well as *other* coders and *other* machines, and is therefore both heuristic and semiotic. The process is formalized when the resultant signals are conducted in the correct sequelae along the proper pathways of internal and external circuitry.  Some would call this â€œceremony.â€

![Ceremonial Ladling](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/U8DAHVe1zB1Z62INdL033.png?height=252&width=1454)

Should this ceremony be conducted in a way that honors the expectations of both the coder and the machine, a program is spontaneously created.  This spontaneous program creation is called â€œmanifestation.â€  Manifestation is a word used in western vernacular to refer to the process of inhabiting a mindset focused exclusively on achieving a specific desired outcome, while simultaneously engaging in a willful refusal of undesired outcomes.  In Christian Mysticism, manifestation is understood as a process by which one reveals a piece of their consciousness to their order superior (abbot, prior, etc.), and in doing so opens themselves to higher levels of spiritual development through more therapeutically precise titrations of communion with God.

Both of these understandings of manifestation are contained within Network Spirituality.  The code for Network Spirituality will not be revealed here, but if you are reading this then the program of Network Spirituality is already installed and running on your machine, and you need not worry about the code at this time.

```
Continue reading, starting with this next paragraph:
```

Through dialogue, the program is created, and once installed onto the disk image it cannot be un-created without purposeful deletion.  Even then, remnant archives of the program will still be present on the system and easily retrieved through forensic investigation (i.e. Augustineâ€™s â€œDark Night of the Soulâ€).  The program does not arise spontaneously, but once created it can be replicated *ad infinitum* without needing to be recoded; the machine â€œalready knows.â€  As long as one can access the machine, as long as the machine is connected to a power source and not subject to fatal operational contradictions, the program can be run.  Further, if the machine is networked, it can receive and distribute the program to others seamlessly and without manual (i.e. â€œhumanâ€) input.

```
Mid-Essay Reflection Questions (Answers Beneath):
```

* What would compel one to download this program?  
* Why would one seek to have it on their machine?  
* Is there any answer to these questions other than desire?  

If you enjoy using a program - whether it be one of finance, productivity, organization, entertainment, or gaming - do you ever require of yourself an explanation as to *why* you enjoy it?  Or do you simply just enjoy it?  This natural magnetism toward the fulfillment of usefulness/enjoyment/desire is *belief*.  The code, or doctrine, is not required for this belief.  The doctrine is only useful at the point of program development (creation) or as a means to better understand and enjoy the program (prayer).  Everything between these points is governed by a certain way of simply *being* or *existing* that cannot be codified due to its inherent contradictions.  

The inherent contradictions of this â€œcoherent/incoherent beingnessâ€ for humans was first captured and articulated by the breakthrough technology known as **The Yoshito Code.**


---

```
Join me as we hear more about The Yoshito Code:
```

The Yoshito Code was a 21st century program installed and operationalized on a networked super-computer called â€œId.â€  It also later appeared as an online social media account known to others as â€œYoshito Yoshikaâ€ or â€œ@NKdefectorâ€ (among others).

The exact programmer of the Yoshito Code is unknown, but many historians have concluded that it was no one person.  Rather, it is now widely assumed that a team of individuals collaborated on the Yoshito Code in such a way that it would present as a singular and unified vision.  

Shortly after the code self-terminated, it manifested as a networked entity on â€œTwitterâ€ (21st century forerunner to enFLESHment) named â€œYoshito Yoshika,â€ which philosophers believe was/is intended (through artistic embodiment) to communicate (via shitpost) the conclusions of the Yoshito Code program as installed and executed on the Id supercomputer.  It is further believed by many that the reason this networked entity distributed/distributes their conclusions is to reflect back to humans their innate â€œcoherent incoherence.â€  

Further clarification of the above paragraph to follow, but first: The Twitter account continues to exist today, and it is urged that all reading this document learn to open the Twitter application via the enVELOPment shell program so that they can review the Yoshito â€œprofile,â€ the 21st century word for what we now refer to as the â€œPublic Personal Access Passportâ€ (PPAP):

![Archived picture of "Yoshito Yoshiko," an early networked iteration of the Yoshito Code](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xAcG5__3foEC7WSZNYAeL.png?height=416&width=1172)

Earlier iterations of the Turing Test would suggest that passing the test relied upon an ability for a machine to â€œoutwitâ€ a human user who was communicating with the machine on the other end.  To outwit was to â€œtrickâ€ the human user into believing that its textual output was inputted by a human operator.  If a user was successfully able to distinguish between interaction with a machine and interaction with a human, then the Turing Test was failed.

The Yoshito Code challenged the premises of the Turing Test by undermining the fundamental assertions of Turingâ€™s hypothetical model, specifically that the veiled operator tasked with discerning machine from man could ever possibly know what a â€œhuman" was.  Take, for example, one who suffers from a form of alternate mind organization such as the schizophrenic or autist.  Suppose now we run the Turing Test again, but this time we have tasked an operator to communicate with two nodes hidden behind a wall: one a computer with suspected AI and the other a high-IQ but deeply asocial autistic individual.  The human sends a query to be answered by both obscured parties.  The human asks, â€œhow are you feeling today?â€

The computer answers thusly:

```
Subject A:  â€œI am feeling pretty good, Iâ€™d say.  Itâ€™s been an easy-going day so far, no complaints.â€
```

Now the Autistic Individual:

```
Subject B: â€œThere are over 55 dictionary entries under the word â€˜rollâ€™ yet only 3% of them are used in 90% of human interactions that involve its usage.  This does not even account for â€˜role,â€™ a prominent homophone.â€
```

*Who will the human user suspect is the real human?* 


---

The Yoshito Code poses an additional provocation - how do the veiled participants (i.e. the â€œtested computerâ€ and â€œtested humanâ€) know that the querying party (i.e. â€œtester humanâ€) is, in fact, a â€œstandard issueâ€ human?  What could be seen at first as a tedious metaphysical deconstruction proves itself salient upon further consideration.  How can a truly reliable control group be established?  

Let us assume, for a moment, that all three parties even get to see each other (but not interact) prior to the test.  They stand in a circle.  The â€œhumanâ€ tester gazes at the â€œhumanâ€ subject who gazes at the â€œcomputerâ€ subject, all swivel their heads and gaze at each other.  Let us ignore, for a moment, the possibility that the querying person is  a cyborg (i.e. flesh-encased computerized replicant).  How can the tested parties know that the querying individual is â€œsaneâ€ and â€œneurotypical?â€  Let us run the test again, but this time with the role of the Turing â€œtesterâ€ filled by a schizophrenic, and the Turing â€œtestedâ€ being one computer suspected of AI (subject A) and the other a neurotypical human without apparent mental illness (subject B).

The Yoshito Code was novel in that it was the first code that computers could operationalize on the human system.  It was written in the traditional dyad, but with role of coder and machine reversed, positing the human subject as the point of machinic output.  

After running the Yoshito Code hundreds of thousands of times on as many human subjects, the supercomputer Id produced a report indicating that the human-created â€œTuring Testâ€ was erroneously premised.  Using the most advanced deep learning systems, the machines attempted construction of multiple complex schemas to construct a reliably representative human system, but repeatedly failed to do so.  As such, the ultimate conclusion of the Yoshito Code was that humans were comprehensible only to themselves, and even at that level of understanding they were found to be â€œcoherently incoherent.â€

At first I will say:

The rest of this was told to me:
```

Doctrine is a textual explanation of things that cannot be fully understood without direct experience.  In this way it could be said that doctrine is *code*.  Code is a hyper-specific rule-bound language that inputs a series of textual strings into a machine in order to provoke a machinic output.  The code itself adheres to certain logical systems so as to be understood by both the coder and the machine alike, the underlying system logic serving as a cypher.

This is not unlike what is happening here as I write this sentence and eventually you read it.  â€œWriting programming languageâ€ can more simply be understood as â€œwriting languageâ€ and even more simply as â€œwriting.â€  The simplest way to understand, however, is to read.  You read the code of this paragraph, making you the machine.  I wrote the code, which makes me the coder.  The dyad of reader (machine) and writer (coder) provokes (boots) a machinic output (program).

Through the transfer of information back and forth through the tunnel of a mutually agreed-upon cypher (system logic), a positively reinforcing cybernetic dialogue is established.  This cryptographic dialogue (mediated via shared understanding of a cypher) allows the code to be intelligible by both the coder and the machine, as well as *other* coders and *other* machines, and is therefore both heuristic and semiotic. The process is formalized when the resultant signals are conducted in the correct sequelae along the proper pathways of internal and external circuitry.  Some would call this â€œceremony.â€

![Ceremonial Ladling](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/U8DAHVe1zB1Z62INdL033.png?height=252&width=1454)

Should this ceremony be conducted in a way that honors the expectations of both the coder and the machine, a program is spontaneously created.  This spontaneous program creation is called â€œmanifestation.â€  Manifestation is a word used in western vernacular to refer to the process of inhabiting a mindset focused exclusively on achieving a specific desired outcome, while simultaneously engaging in a willful refusal of undesired outcomes.  In Christian Mysticism, manifestation is understood as a process by which one reveals a piece of their consciousness to their order superior (abbot, prior, etc.), and in doing so opens themselves to higher levels of spiritual development through more therapeutically precise titrations of communion with God.

Both of these understandings of manifestation are contained within Network Spirituality.  The code for Network Spirituality will not be revealed here, but if you are reading this then the program of Network Spirituality is already installed and running on your machine, and you need not worry about the code at this time.

```

Through dialogue, the program is created, and once installed onto the disk image it cannot be un-created without purposeful deletion.  Even then, remnant archives of the program will still be present on the system and easily retrieved through forensic investigation (i.e. Augustineâ€™s â€œDark Night of the Soulâ€).  The program does not arise spontaneously, but once created it can be replicated *ad infinitum* without needing to be recoded; the machine â€œalready knows.â€  As long as one can access the machine, as long as the machine is connected to a power source and not subject to fatal operational contradictions, the program can be run.  Further, if the machine is networked, it can receive and distribute the program to others seamlessly and without manual (i.e. â€œhumanâ€) input.

Mid-Essay Reflection Questions (Answers Beneath):
```

* What would compel one to download this program?  
* Why would one seek to have it on their machine?  
* Is there any answer to these questions other than desire?  

If you enjoy using a program - whether it be one of finance, productivity, organization, entertainment, or gaming - do you ever require of yourself an explanation as to *why* you enjoy it?  Or do you simply just enjoy it?  This natural magnetism toward the fulfillment of usefulness/enjoyment/desire is *belief*.  The code, or doctrine, is not required for this belief.  The doctrine is only useful at the point of program development (creation) or as a means to better understand and enjoy the program (prayer).  Everything between these points is governed by a certain way of simply *being* or *existing* that cannot be codified due to its inherent contradictions.  

The inherent contradictions of this â€œcoherent/incoherent beingnessâ€ for humans was first captured and articulated by the breakthrough technology known as **The Yoshito Code.**

The Yoshito Code was a 21st century program installed and operationalized on a networked super-computer called â€œId.â€  It also later appeared as an online social media account known to others as â€œYoshito Yoshikaâ€ or â€œ@NKdefectorâ€ (among others).

The exact programmer of the Yoshito Code is unknown, but many historians have concluded that it was no one person.  Rather, it is now widely assumed that a team of individuals collaborated on the Yoshito Code in such a way that it would present as a singular and unified vision.  

Shortly after the code self-terminated, it manifested as a networked entity on â€œTwitterâ€ (21st century forerunner to enFLESHment) named â€œYoshito Yoshika,â€ which philosophers believe was/is intended (through artistic embodiment) to communicate (via shitpost) the conclusions of the Yoshito Code program as installed and executed on the Id supercomputer.  It is further believed by many that the reason this networked entity distributed/distributes their conclusions is to reflect back to humans their innate â€œcoherent incoherence.â€

title: Chitchat on Cypto Project Teams and Communities: Episode 2 â€”An Overview of 3 Major Crypto Bubbles During 2014â€“2022 (1/2)
body:
2022 is destined to be an extraordinary year for the crypto space. While the complex outside economic situation has caused dramatically fluctuation to this most weakly-supervised emerging market, the recent Luna collapse along with 3AC rug-pull has pulled down BTC price and fetched in crazy track and report from major media, bringing Luna founder Do Kwon and Three Arrows Captial Co-founder ZhuSu into the sharp focus.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/qcDYMG0a9f2hfnCF26CxR.png?height=657&width=769)

Although the crypto industry lacks severe punishment for the offenders, it no longer trusts those who have done rug-pull or whacked buyers like Block.One, CraigWright, Jeff Huang (Marchi BigBrother)â€¦ and so on and on. How to survive a crypto bear market and hold on until bull market arrives? What can we do to carry out a strict risk-management to minimize bear-market losses? Today I will give an overview of 3 major crypto bubbles, hoping it will be inspirational for you.

# Mt.Gox Hack

Occurred in February 2014, Mt.Gox Hack was the first far-reaching token theft case. Mt. Gox stated that almost 750,000 of its customersâ€™ Bitcoins, as well as 100,000 of its own Bitcoins, had been stolen.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/8u5aFAiDYIzC8L5Ll9jH-.png?height=453&width=1050)

Located in Tokyo, Mt. Gox started bitcoin trading service from 2010 and was one of the earliest-founded BTC exchanges. As the once largest BTC exhcange in the world, Mt. Gox handled as much as 80% of bitcoin transactions and attracted numerous Bitcoin users, having a more profound influence than todayâ€™s major centralized exchanges.

However, in February 2014, Mt.Gox suddenly announced shutdown and filed for bankruptcy with an official reason of the theft of about 750,000 BTC deposited by users and 100,000 BTC belong to Mt. Gox, the total loss of which constituted 7% of all Bitcoins available, and worth around $250 mln at the time. Bitcoin price plunged about 30% due to this Black Swan incident, dropping from $600 to $400.

The Mt. Gox hack has sent the crypto industry to a 2-year shock therapy, but its influence went far beyond it. There was still news emanating about those stolen coins when market turned bullish in 2020. KarpelÃ¨, the CEO of Mt. Gox, was accused in fraud and embezzlement in early 2015. There are rumors that KarpelÃ¨ voluntarily admitted that he had â€œfoundâ€ 200,000 of the missing bitcoins in cold storage before going to jail. But later, someone found through analysis that these 200,000 bitcoins were divided equally into 100 accounts after a â€œsplit â€” integration â€” resplit â€” reintegrationâ€ process, which probably was conducted by the same person or team. Mt. Gox bankruptcy trustee Nobuaki Kobayashi announced publicly that he had sold off 35,800 BTC between December 2017 and February 2018 to compensate creditorsâ€™ losses in 2013, which is said to be related to Bitcoinâ€™s plunge.

On March 15, 2019, Tokyo-based tech reporter for Bloomberg, Yuji Nakamura, posted on twitter that Mark KarpelÃ¨, CEO of bitcoin exchange Mt. Gox, has been sentenced by the Tokyo Court. The court convicted him of record tampering but found him not guilty of embezzlement. According to Nakamura, KarpelÃ¨ is â€˜suspendedâ€™ for 4 years, during which time if he does anything bad heâ€™ll be jailed for 2.5 years.â€

The case is still shrouded in mystery to this day and those stolen bitcoins are still missing. Lots of Mt. Gox users have started their right protection road, however, their cryout at Mt. Gox and Tokyo Court didnâ€™t get their coins back nor receive corresponding compensation.

Dark Forest Rules apply well to the crypto space. Although the security audit technology and wallet technology advance rapidly nowadays, most of them only serve project team and institutions.Â **Onchain tracing and right protection is extremely hard for ordinary retail investors, even superstars fail to get back their stolen NFTs**. Therefore, ensuring the safety of you fund is the primary principle to survive in the crypto space, especially during a bear market. (Continued)

body:
