title: If you can be anyone, where do you start?
body:
Iâ€™m having an identity crisis.

The cataclysmic moment was creating my Bumble BFF profile. It is one thing to design your identity for dating â€” pick the best photos, surface a cult-classic film, link your Spotify for street cred â€” but when profiling for friends it isnâ€™t that simple. Photos are part of your aesthetic but which me do I squeeze into 300 characters?! My sporty, health conscious self? My meandering bookstore self? My boozy brunch and bender self?

When they ask â€œwrite something about yourselfâ€ I end up asking â€œwho even am I?!â€

Iâ€™m a chameleon.

It is hard to answer that question because I augment around my surroundings and influences. Mostly it means I live in happy harmony with the world around me and have a kaleidoscope of friends, influences, passions and interests. But, at times this leads me to an identity crisis and I have the distinct urge to rip it up and start afresh. Purge those that reflect too brightly my old self in search of something new and appealing.

Thank god for Facebook and Googleâ€¦JOKES! I have not pledged allegiance to the almighty tech gods but it did get me thinking about the simplicity of a managed identity. One where I didnâ€™t need to think. Identity is a complex concept, it can happen unnoticed as we go through life but unfurls when given focus.

If Facebook were a person, how would it describe you? Those cheeky Instagram stalks, archived WhatsApp chats and panicked DrGoogle searches all contribute to how your friend, Facebook, sees you. This is what we call â€œfederated identityâ€, whereby all the factors that make up who we are including our late night sleuthing is stored and organised for the convenience of a consolidated identity.

Now, imagine having that power back. This is what we call â€œself-sovereign identityâ€, and if we pare back the web3 chat it simply means you, not Facebook, are responsible for all that information about you. How it is used or not used is completely in your control. This means how the world sees you is more in your control than before because you are managing what is stored and how it is used. One way you do this is through a *wallet*. Just like your physical wallet that holds your driverâ€™s licence, bank cards and loyalty cards but itâ€™s digital.

This new era is akin to that wonderful time in Kindergarten, youâ€™ve been given a blank piece of paper and asked to draw who you want to be when you grow up. You have an infinite number of choices at your fingertips to primp and prune *you*. Do you relish the opportunity or are you paralysed with choice; do you look around at the other kids to see what theyâ€™re drawing or do you shy away so no one can see what youâ€™re doing; do you proudly declare your masterpiece or roll-it up and put it away?

When I was drawing my future self I looked around, drew inspiration from those around me then in my characteristically competitive self went about trying to better or improve upon it. A little for bragging but mostly for group recognition. Where I started was largely dependent on the world around me. It gave me a foundation to start my drawing by narrowing my options.

Now we are in a time of infinite others to peer over, and infinite colouring pencils to choose from.

This new found identity freedom could feel daunting if not paralysing. There is no end point if identity is in part grounded by technology because of its progressive nature. There is an exponential growth in identity variables where before your options were narrowed by what was available and accessible.

Now we can unshackle self exploration and our identity from finite, binary categories or permanency. We can explore many nuances of ourselves, we can even create different *wallets* that hold different types of information to not confuse the different versions of you. We are creating multiple drawings, some stick figures and others Rembrandts, some to be stuck on the fridge and others just for us to enjoy.

We are happening upon an exciting time of self exploration and Iâ€™m coming through my crisis by realising I am not finished defining who I am. As a self-confessed chameleon I have many more communities and worlds to discover. Most importantly these worlds are expanding exponentially thanks to new technologies and quite naturally wonâ€™t always overlap or interact. Life is not lived in Venn diagrams.

Building a rich tapestry of contributors to my identity has meant not any one person or passion will have outsized expectations to fulfil and that is beautiful. My meaningful relationships can blossom while I continue to discover new and different influences. For me this new found control of identity, of how I present myself and navigate the digital realm has unlocked my sense of adventure.

The idea of showing up to a room full of people who are expertly navigating a diverse range of topics makes my palms sweat â€” but observing via a Discord Chat is being a digital fly on the wall. Expressing yourself via an avatar can feel like wearing a fake moustache and glasses to a conversation â€” you are covert, unrecognisable yet reaping the full benefits of the interaction. It isnâ€™t about hiding, it is about having access and choice and ultimately control.

There is so much discussion swirling around web3, a lot of noise about NFTs and an entirely new vocabulary branching off of *decentralised*. Where we will land I do not know but it is not likely to be Earnest Clineâ€™s Ready Player One or George Orwellâ€™s 1984 in our lifetime.

If you, like me, are suffering an identity crisis then I recommend getting out there! Create an avatar on Genies. Join a discord chat, if youâ€™re a sneakerhead check out Adidas Originals or for a great, female-led entrepreneurial group BFF. Make pizza in Roblox and roam Decentraland. Follow Snoop-Dogg on Twitter. Get familiar with mirror.xyz journalism. Create your ENS name.

Have fun with the different ways you can be you.

It is not unreal to explore new things, it is not inauthentic to be many things. It is entirely human and more than ever technology is enabling our innate sense of exploration and expansion.

Tell you something about myself, where do I even start!

title: Roe vs Wade and your period data - who is in control?
body:
**If you felt uneasy seeing the suspicious Instagram ad for car upholstery minutes after discussing it then have you considered how your health data can be leveraged in a post Roe vs Wade world?**

Like 43 million other people around the world I use Flo to monitor my periods. I use it because I like knowing more about my body, like when I can expect my period or why my face is having a throwback to 90s acne fashion.

I also joined more than 290 million people in 2021 and bought myself a wearable. Not just any wearable, I wanted the Garmin sports watch that revealed data Iâ€™d never even heard of. I wanted so much data that I had to spend more time searching for metric definitions than reading the data itself.

I never take my watch off. I sleep with it on so I can use the data to inform how I should feel when I wake up. I have literally outsourced my feelings to technology.

Never did I once stop to think about how all this health data could be used against me. Akin to requesting my medical history, what is stopping my health insurance provider from requesting my watch data and what happens if I say no (can I even say no?).

Trawling Twitter I came across the [Mashable](https://mashable.com/article/period-apps-roe-v-wade) article *Period Apps in a Post-Roe World*. I was truly startled by the question - who owns my period data. I had never questioned it but now that data could be weaponised against women and I feel scared.

I feel scared because weâ€™ve been indoctrinated into a world of technology and regulation as trusting.

Weâ€™ve blindly outsourced control and when it turned against us we assumed regulators and legislators could step in to rescue us. That has largely not worked. Weâ€™re disrupted by a variety of unstandardised data pop-ups at the most inopportune times that make saying no hard. Now weâ€™re facing legislation that is removing choice altogether.

In 2011 South Park released HUMANCENTiPAD which depicts the bleakest of outcomes when we donâ€™t read our T&Cs. After this, for the shortest time, I read my T&Cs but theyâ€™re very boring and the vernacular makes me feel stupid. It is unpleasant in enough ways that the memory of HUMANCENTiPAD dissipated and I went back to blind acceptance.

In 2018 there was excitement around wearables as a tool to intercept medical emergencies amongst the elderly. The monitoring of wearable data could enable our elderly community to lead a more independent life. I loved it. I never once stopped to think about the paradox of independence through monitoring.

In 2020 an Australia court [forced Google](https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2020/feb/14/court-says-melbourne-dentist-can-serve-google-for-user-details-over-bad-review) to reveal the identity of an anonymous user who left a negative review of a Dentistry, and in 2022 [forced Twitter](https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2022/jun/07/twitter-ordered-to-hand-over-prguy17s-personal-information-as-part-of-defamation-suit) to reveal the identity of a pseudonymous account following a defamation claim. Iâ€™m not convinced the everyday social user is aware that their personal data can be solicited in this way.

Bringing us back to 2022 and we have emerging technologies enabling trustless systems and sovereign identity. It is a momentous shift and people are not flocking to this new sense of control because it is scary AF. It is intended to feel complicated, full of codified language to keep laypeople out. If Iâ€™m worried about how the Australian Government can access my personal data Iâ€™m sure as hell not ready to consider a totally anonymous tech-fluent entity as the next best option.

It is hard not to hark back to South Parkâ€™s 2004 Douche and Turd episode. By that I mean weâ€™re faced with less than ideal options and it can feel hopeless. By no means do I want people to feel that way. New technologies are not ready for full-on adoption and old technologies are so ingrained that total disconnection is near impossible.

Instead I say it is time we got a little curious about data storage. I think it is unreasonable to read all your T&Cs and a world without all this amazing technology would suck. But, you should know where your data is stored to understand what laws protect you as a user.

For example, if your data is stored in Europe, like the users of Flo, then you are protected by some of the most advanced digital and data legislation in the world such as GDPR and the Digital Services Act. At the very least get familiar with who makes the big decisions in your country and how that extends to you. For example, GDPR protects the processing of data for all EU residents regardless of where they live.

By knowing who governs your data and how apps can use it means you are more empowered to make choices that favour your rights. I implore you to take this small step towards control in our tech interfaced world. Start with the apps you use the most, the ones that know the most about you or access the most personal of your data.

Our internet is full of variety and choice, you can always find a better solution to suit all your needs including privacy. Or, if not build one. You as the user have the power and you donâ€™t need to settle.

PS - if like me your T&Cs still scare you, or if you just watched HUMANCENTiPAD then <https://tosdr.org/> might come in handy.

title: The Future Of Futures: Is Tsunami taking crypto to new levels?
body:
The universe of crypto as we know, is ever changing and the excitement never seems to end! I can tell you by experience, since 2016 when I first entered, almost nothing is the same. New innovations and projects continue to change finance as we know it, and Tsunami is the newest one to do it.

I welcome you all to Tsunami Token. Built on the Waves Blockchain with a total supply of only 1 Million, Tsunami (TSN) aims to be the first of its kind to enable decentralized Perpetual Futures on the blockchain! A successful testnet was also completed with a turnout of +3500 participants. In partnership with Puzzle.surf, Tsunami began an explosive ILO! Upon the market becoming live, Tsunami shot out of the gate. Investors were in disbelief as the token jumped from $0.20 to $5.00 and eventually settled around $3.00. Within hours, Tsunami had a $3,000,000 market cap! Currently, the token is sitting at $4.90. If this is any indication of whatâ€™s to come, itâ€™s that Tsunami will take us all by storm!

Now onto expanding on what Tsunami has to offer, itâ€™s quite the change of pace in crypto. Perpetual Futures on the blockchain. Futures contracts can have any token paired against each other while traders bet on the future price. Doing so and placing their positions by adding liquid to the market, portions of this goes into the Funding Rate, which incentivizes traders to keep the market price as close to the index price as possible. There is potential for extreme profits in Futures as you have leverage at your disposal. Leverage is the use of borrowed capital to multiply your earnings and that is where the vAMM comes into play. Tsunami has what you call a virtual Automated Market Maker or vAMM that provides polymerized leverage to the market. Its essential roles are price discovery and leverage up to 10x what you have invested. Of course this can work in your favor or against you, depending on your position and market conditions. Price swings surrounding cryptocurrency is no secret. By bringing futures into the mix of highly volatile markets and major price swings, it will be quite a sight to see once Tsunamis exchange goes live!

Lastly, I would like to mention that Tsunami holders will also have the opportunity to stake their TSN. Acquire more TSN for simply not selling the ones you already have! Its a great way for Tsunami to hold its value while investors gain a commission for not selling them. Staking will also allow you the benefit to help shape and form Tsunami as a whole with your very own suggestions, opinions and insights. Own some Tsunami? You have a say. I also understand that Tsunami isnâ€™t stopping here and will be bringing new products down the line. We will have to patiently wait and see what they bring to the table next!

Will Tsunami take the crypto universe by storm? Only time will tell but my thoughts are leaning towards yes! Do you agree? Iâ€™ll be writing more about this Token in the future and as always, Thanks for reading!

title: The Future Of Futures: Is Tsunami taking crypto to new levels?
body:
The universe of crypto as we know, is ever changing and the excitement never seems to end! I can tell you by experience, since 2016 when I first entered, almost nothing is the same. New innovations and projects continue to change finance as we know it, and Tsunami is the newest one to do it.

I welcome you all to Tsunami Token. Built on the Waves Blockchain with a total supply of only 1 Million, Tsunami (TSN) aims to be the first of its kind to enable decentralized Perpetual Futures on the blockchain! A successful testnet was also completed with a turnout of +3500 participants. In partnership with Puzzle.surf, Tsunami began an explosive ILO! Upon the market becoming live, Tsunami shot out of the gate. Investors were in disbelief as the token jumped from $0.20 to $5.00 and eventually settled around $3.00. Within hours, Tsunami had a $3,000,000 market cap! Currently, the token is sitting at $4.90. If this is any indication of whatâ€™s to come, itâ€™s that Tsunami will take us all by storm!

Now onto expanding on what Tsunami has to offer, itâ€™s quite the change of pace in crypto. Perpetual Futures on the blockchain. Futures contracts can have any token paired against each other while traders bet on the future price. Doing so and placing their positions by adding liquid to the market, portions of this goes into the Funding Rate, which incentivizes traders to keep the market price as close to the index price as possible. There is potential for extreme profits in Futures as you have leverage at your disposal. Leverage is the use of borrowed capital to multiply your earnings and that is where the vAMM comes into play. Tsunami has what you call a virtual Automated Market Maker or vAMM that provides polymerized leverage to the market. Its essential roles are price discovery and leverage up to 10x what you have invested. Of course this can work in your favor or against you, depending on your position and market conditions. Price swings surrounding cryptocurrency is no secret. By bringing futures into the mix of highly volatile markets and major price swings, it will be quite a sight to see once Tsunamis exchange goes live!

Lastly, I would like to mention that Tsunami holders will also have the opportunity to stake their TSN. Acquire more TSN for simply not selling the ones you already have! Its a great way for Tsunami to hold its value while investors gain a commission for not selling them. Staking will also allow you the benefit to help shape and form Tsunami as a whole with your very own suggestions, opinions and insights. Own some Tsunami? You have a say. I also understand that Tsunami isnâ€™t stopping here and will be bringing new products down the line. We will have to patiently wait and see what they bring to the table next!

Will Tsunami take the crypto universe by storm? Only time will tell but my thoughts are leaning towards yes! Do you agree? Iâ€™ll be writing more about this Token in the future and as always, Thanks for reading!

title: The Future Of Futures: Is Tsunami taking crypto to new levels?
body:
The universe of crypto as we know, is ever changing and the excitement never seems to end! I can tell you by experience, since 2016 when I first entered, almost nothing is the same. New innovations and projects continue to change finance as we know it, and Tsunami is the newest one to do it.

I welcome you all to Tsunami Token. Built on the Waves Blockchain with a total supply of only 1 Million, Tsunami (TSN) aims to be the first of its kind to enable decentralized Perpetual Futures on the blockchain! A successful testnet was also completed with a turnout of +3500 participants. In partnership with Puzzle.surf, Tsunami began an explosive ILO! Upon the market becoming live, Tsunami shot out of the gate. Investors were in disbelief as the token jumped from $0.20 to $5.00 and eventually settled around $3.00. Within hours, Tsunami had a $3,000,000 market cap! Currently, the token is sitting at $4.90. If this is any indication of whatâ€™s to come, itâ€™s that Tsunami will take us all by storm!

Now onto expanding on what Tsunami has to offer, itâ€™s quite the change of pace in crypto. Perpetual Futures on the blockchain. Futures contracts can have any token paired against each other while traders bet on the future price. Doing so and placing their positions by adding liquid to the market, portions of this goes into the Funding Rate, which incentivizes traders to keep the market price as close to the index price as possible. There is potential for extreme profits in Futures as you have leverage at your disposal. Leverage is the use of borrowed capital to multiply your earnings and that is where the vAMM comes into play. Tsunami has what you call a virtual Automated Market Maker or vAMM that provides polymerized leverage to the market. Its essential roles are price discovery and leverage up to 10x what you have invested. Of course this can work in your favor or against you, depending on your position and market conditions. Price swings surrounding cryptocurrency is no secret. By bringing futures into the mix of highly volatile markets and major price swings, it will be quite a sight to see once Tsunamis exchange goes live!

Lastly, I would like to mention that Tsunami holders will also have the opportunity to stake their TSN. Acquire more TSN for simply not selling the ones you already have! Its a great way for Tsunami to hold its value while investors gain a commission for not selling them. Staking will also allow you the benefit to help shape and form Tsunami as a whole with your very own suggestions, opinions and insights. Own some Tsunami? You have a say. I also understand that Tsunami isnâ€™t stopping here and will be bringing new products down the line. We will have to patiently wait and see what they bring to the table next!

Will Tsunami take the crypto universe by storm? Only time will tell but my thoughts are leaning towards yes! Do you agree? Iâ€™ll be writing more about this Token in the future and as always, Thanks for reading!

To learn more about Tsunami, please check out their telegram!

title: The Future Of Futures: Is Tsunami taking crypto to new levels?
body:
The universe of crypto as we know, is ever changing and the excitement never seems to end! I can tell you by experience, since 2016 when I first entered, almost nothing is the same. New innovations and projects continue to change finance as we know it, and Tsunami is the newest one to do it.

I welcome you all to Tsunami Token. Built on the Waves Blockchain with a total supply of only 1 Million, Tsunami (TSN) aims to be the first of its kind to enable decentralized Perpetual Futures on the blockchain! A successful testnet was also completed with a turnout of +3500 participants. In partnership with Puzzle.surf, Tsunami began an explosive ILO! Upon the market becoming live, Tsunami shot out of the gate. Investors were in disbelief as the token jumped from $0.20 to $5.00 and eventually settled around $3.00. Within hours, Tsunami had a $3,000,000 market cap! Currently, the token is sitting at $4.90. If this is any indication of whatâ€™s to come, itâ€™s that Tsunami will take us all by storm!

Now onto expanding on what Tsunami has to offer, itâ€™s quite the change of pace in crypto. Perpetual Futures on the blockchain. Futures contracts can have any token paired against each other while traders bet on the future price. Doing so and placing their positions by adding liquid to the market, portions of this goes into the Funding Rate, which incentivizes traders to keep the market price as close to the index price as possible. There is potential for extreme profits in Futures as you have leverage at your disposal. Leverage is the use of borrowed capital to multiply your earnings and that is where the vAMM comes into play. Its essential roles are price discovery and leverage up to 10x what you have invested. Of course this can work in your favor or against you, depending on your position and market conditions. Price swings surrounding cryptocurrency is no secret. By bringing futures into the mix of highly volatile markets and major price swings, it will be quite a sight to see once Tsunamis exchange goes live!

Its a great way for Tsunami to hold its value while investors gain a commission for not selling them. Staking will also allow you the benefit to help shape and form Tsunami as a whole with your very own suggestions, opinions and insights. Own some Tsunami? You have a say. I also understand that Tsunami isnâ€™t stopping here and will be bringing new products down the line. We will have to patiently wait and see what they bring to the table next!

title: A SMPL likeness
body:
[https://twitter.com/GilbertAgain/status/1540388623157190657?s=20&t=MaOEX3hTE3K_TdS6Cn0wvA](https://twitter.com/GilbertAgain/status/1540388623157190657?s=20&t=MaOEX3hTE3K_TdS6Cn0wvA)

> *Look at them, my dear witless double. When I first set eyes on them our resemblance struck me as spectacular, bordering on the freakish. I had never supposed it possible that there could exist such a living duplicate. A pixel perfect likeness. As my gaze lingered upon this fascinating creature its utility began to make itself known to me. I became obsessed with what the very existence of a live circulating copy of my face might enable. We two, I thought, are as alike as two drops of blood.*

The preceding paragraph is derived from Vladimir Nabokovâ€™s 1937 novel *Despair*. Iâ€™ve taken the liberty of recomposing and updating Nabokovâ€™s prose, introducing a few subtle inflections of our contemporary digital culture. Itâ€™s what I do. Hermann Karlovich, the first person protagonist of *Despair*, is a wealthy but unfulfilled businessman suffering from a debilitating existential angst. One day while out walking, he happens upon a man sleeping under a thornbush on a hillside. Hermann is immediately transfixed by the strangerâ€™s image. *That man, especially when he slept, when his features were motionless, showed me my own face, my mask, the flawlessly pure image of my corpse ...* The life of Felix Wohlfahrt, Hermannâ€™s innocent doppelgÃ¤nger, is only minimally acknowledged by our unsteady narrator. We learn that Felix is poor and homeless, an *oaf* who exhibits *the whole bouquet of human stupidity*. His wellbeing is ultimately of little concern to Hermann, however. Over the course of the novel Felix is taken for a mere object, a fungible prop in a murderous scheme that he has unknowingly inspired in Hermann. The details of this scheme,Â a masterful conceptual artwork in Hermannâ€™s own estimation, are predictable enough. If Felix were to be found dead in certain circumstances ... *his* fate would appear as *Hermannâ€™s* fate ... Hermann would effectively be recused from his own tedious life ... and Felix himself would hardly be missed ... Hermannâ€™s ever faithful wife Lydia could claim his ample life insurance and ...

As Felix is to Hermann, so my [SMPL #030754](https://etherscan.io/nft/0x4370CB4Eb0926AC022Bb87D268Fa39f34cc0DdFC/6) is to me, your Gilbert. While Hermannâ€™s scheme was inspired by a chance meeting, I could rely on [SMPLverse](https://www.smplverse.xyz), an interactive digital artwork that conveniently facilitated the discovery of my own *flawless* likeness. And just like Hermannâ€™s encounter with Felix, the moment when SMPLs began to appear on my timeline was truly fateful. Ever since I saw those hollow dummies, staring blankly into non-space, a plan â€” *this* plan, the formulation of *these* words and images â€”Â has preoccupied me. SMPLverse draws on an [open source repository](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/research/uploads/prod/2021/10/ICCV_2021_FaceSynthetics.pdf) of 100,000 nameless nobodies. These completely synthetic images of human faces were generated as training data for Microsoftâ€™s HoloLens mixed-reality project. Holders of a SMPL token need only present themselves to a webcam interface to acquire their duplicate. When the hour of the SMPLverse mint came, I offered my head up and a facial recognition algorithm found the best match for my image in its repository. The closeness of that match was expressed through the attribution of a *confidence* score, a fractional number between 0 and 1. At the time of writing, the confidence score of 0.527 between #030754 and I remains the highest in the collection. This plan SMPLy cannot fail.

Hermann, though, is plainly an *overconfident* man. Signs appear everywhere in Nabokovâ€™s plot that his protagonist is not always as observant as he was in that initial, electrifying sighting of Felix. Hermann has a somewhat selective gaze, and we attentive readers spot numerous mistakes creeping into his criminal plan. Nevertheless, his compulsion seems unstoppable and he does attend to certain details with exceptional rigour. In the novelâ€™s concluding action scene, on the edge of a remote forest at dusk, Hermann performs a grooming ritual on Felix, resolving any outstanding disparities in their resemblance. Having been given an unlikely explanation and promised a cash reward for his participation in these macabre proceedings, unsuspecting Felix is compliant. Hermann shaves the face of his twin, thins out the eyebrows to match his own, brushes back the hair. As they swap clothes, Hermann notices Felixâ€™s filthy toenails and a queasy pedicure is performed. When everything is judged to be in order Hermann shoots Felix in the back and decouples himself from the identity of Hermann Karlovich.

[edition://0x938630fe963ccDF1c8a94fF088c11e2cB20A9Fb5?editionId=0](edition://0x938630fe963ccDF1c8a94fF088c11e2cB20A9Fb5?editionId=0)

Except Hermann and Felix did not, in fact, look alike. I would estimate no more than a 0.228, if that. Their resemblance was imagined by Hermann, a telling feature of his descent into psychosis. The collapse of his plan does not take long to emerge. In hiding in Italy, we find Hermann distraught by the reporting of his crime in the international press. Detectives have neglected to recognise Hermann in the corpse of his double! Instead â€” the morons! â€” they seem distracted by minor inconsistencies at the scene. (Hermann does begrudgingly admit to the small logistical mistake of having left one of Felixâ€™s belongings in his abandoned car: a walking stick into which the victim had carved his full name.) Deluded to the very end, Hermann reports the reception of his actions not as evidence of his own troubled mental state but as an absurd failure of interpretative imagination on the part of those investigating his unspeakable crime.

Poor Hermann is scuppered. He certainly turned out to be incompetent, but was he really an evil man? Hermann, I might alternatively claim, was a man paralysed by the transition between two paradigms of identity formation. Hermann belonged to an early twentieth century European society still defined by *sincerity*. In the sincerity paradigm identity was not an expression of the individual, but was *predefined* by their standing in societal class structures. It was on this account that Nabokov had to identify Hermann as a middle-class somebody and Felix as a lower-class nobody for his narrative to be believable. In Hermannâ€™s time, sincerity was on the cusp of being subverted by *authenticity*. In the coming authenticity paradigm, the individual would draw their identity not from external expectations but from *within themselves*, and *in spite* of societal norms. Hermann yearns to become his *authentic* self (a born again playboy on the Italian riviera, perhaps) but the constraints of *sincerity* (joylessly upholding his responsibilities in Berlin) are inescapable to him. The extreme mental state which this yearning produces in Hermann strikingly anticipates the SMPLverse, and digital cultureâ€™s native identity paradigm: *[profilicity](https://doi.org/10.1177%2F0191453718799801)*. In a profilicity paradigm, oneâ€™s identity is neither pre-defined nor discovered, it is constructed and maintained as if from a third person perspective. At the end of *Despair*, in a rare break from introspection, Hermann offers us his lucid vision of the very future in which SMPL #030754 and I might soon find ourselves:

> *It even seems to me sometimes that my basic theme, the resemblance between two persons, has a profound allegorical meaning. This remarkable physical likeness probably appealed to me (subconsciously!) as the promise of that ideal sameness which is to unite people in the classless society of the future; and by striving to make use of an isolated case, I was, though still blind to social truths, fulfilling, nevertheless, a certain social function ... I visualise a new world, where all men will resemble one another as Hermann and Felix did; a world of Helixes and Fermanns; a world where the worker dead at the feet of his machine will be at once replaced by his perfect double smiling the serene smile of perfect socialism.*

title: 3 Role Types. Part 1: Intro | #52
body:
Whenever we design anything, we are designing it for someone. If we donâ€™t understand the context of who this someone is, and what their intent is while using our design, chances are it will not work as well as it could. 

The same principle applies when we design DAOs. We are not (our shouldnâ€™t be) designing just to design, but for the benefit of making someoneâ€™s life better.  

The key question is; who is â€˜someoneâ€™ and what is their intent? 

Before we spend hundreds of hours on member interviews and testing, we can make some assertions on what all â€˜someonesâ€™ have in common within the context of joining a DAO. 

Here are some traits of someone looking to join a community that I have seen from my experience. I have phrased them in the intent form â€˜someone wants to.â€™

1. Someone wants to Observe. 
2. Someone wants to Participate. 
3. Someone wants to Contribute. 

These three intents follow a very basic structure that aligns with the Polyvagal Theory also known as the science of safety and belonging. Itâ€™s likely that you have followed the same structure before you joined your first DAO or community. 

In the context of a DAO, I have found it beneficial to frame these three intents as basic roles that can be used to design meaningful member experiences. Each role comes with its own context, expectations and appropriate actions; and if we can make those easy to understand, follow and execute is makes creating a wonderful experience more likely. 

It behooves the DAO designer to understand why each of these intents exist, and how to structure them into their communities.

In the next three posts I will dive into each one of them, and unpack how they could help you more easily create meaningful experiences for your members.

body:
Whenever we design anything, we are designing it for someone. If we donâ€™t understand the context of who this someone is, and what their intent is while using our design, chances are it will not work as well as it could. 

The same principle applies when we design DAOs. We are not (our shouldnâ€™t be) designing just to design, but for the benefit of making someoneâ€™s life better.  

The key question is; who is â€˜someoneâ€™ and what is their intent? 

Before we spend hundreds of hours on member interviews and testing, we can make some assertions on what all â€˜someonesâ€™ have in common within the context of joining a DAO. 

Here are some traits of someone looking to join a community that I have seen from my experience. I have phrased them in the intent form â€˜someone wants to.â€™

1. Someone wants to Observe. 
2. Someone wants to Participate. 
3. Someone wants to Contribute. 

These three intents follow a very basic structure that aligns with the Polyvagal Theory also known as the science of safety and belonging. Itâ€™s likely that you have followed the same structure before you joined your first DAO or community.

title: Ethereum business model - 75% Profit Margins soon!
body:
The market capital of Bitcoin at the time of writing this article is around USD 400 Bn with a â€œBâ€. Itâ€™s down from its peak market capitalization of USD 1.27 Tn. While market capital of Ethereum is approximately USD 150 Bn down from USD 500 Bn. To put things in perspective, Google has a market capitalization of USD 1.4 Tn and the entire GDP of India is around USD 2.6 Tn the 5th largest GDP in the world.

In short, Bitcoin and Ethereum market caps are HUGE! Google, Amazon, Facebook everyone sells amazing products have earned billions in revenue to attain such valuation and, in turn, market capitalization. But what does Blockchain sell? What is their business model? Are these profitable? Letâ€™s explore the answer to these questions in todayâ€™s post.

**Blockchains are in the business of selling block space.**

Blockchains generally have a limited about of block space. The higher the demand for blockspace, the higher the charges (fees) to use the blockspace. Simple, supply-demand dynamics at play. Now, why do people want to use this block space? Whatâ€™s so special about them? How is it different than a single computer? This block space can be used to record information, run code, and transfer things (currency, digital objects). Itâ€™s a trustless, immutable, decentralized, and permissionless blockspace. It means, ideally, no one can alter or censor anything. This is often expressed via a single term â€œsecurityâ€. Needless to say, security is the most important component. If it is compromised, the block space is not worth much. Therefore, the higher the security, the more valuable the blockspace. Security is essentially derived from independent miners/validators. High decentralization and high miners/validators mean higher security. Miners/validators are similar to employees of the blockchain enabling the ecosystem and ensuring security.

So, letâ€™s see the business model of Ethereum!

Profit = Revenue - Cost

**Revenue â†’** Simply the transaction fees earned by the system. The fees users are willing to pay to use the blockspace. This revenue varies and is dependent on the demand. Over the last year, daily revenue ranged from $4 Mn - $80 Mn! On average around $10-$15 Mn per day!

With EIP-1559, a significant chunk of the fees is burned. When itâ€™s burned, it is kind of equivalent to stock buybacks which adds values to the stocks or in this case coins.

**Burn â†’** Approximately 0.17x of ETH issued currently is burned. This is not a fixed amount and depends on a number of factors. This reduces the supply of ETH in the system. It is interesting to note that this is the primary mechanism of transferring value directly to ETH holders aside from an indirect mechanism of an increase in token value.

Therefore actual revenue of the system is transaction fees - eth burned

**Cost â†’** Fees paid to miners/validators

Currently in a Proof of Work mechanism, Ethereum issues \~4% to miners/validators as a block incentive reward. This incentive is necessary to attract a large number of miners/validators and therefore higher security. This amounts to a total of \~ $32Mn worth of Eth issuance every day.

Clearly, the Ethereum business model is not profitable currently. Itâ€™s similar to a new startup or company which runs promotional campaigns in order to attract network participants. However, the good thing is it soon will be profitable!

With Ethereum migrating to Proof of Stake, the issuance will reduce by 90%! Therefore, its issuance cost post-merge is around $3 Mn. This is less than Ethereum's current average revenue! Therefore, Ethereum will become a profitable business model with a profit margin of \~75%!Â Of course, with continuous innovations, the use cases Ethereum can support will increase. This will further increase the demand and therefore the revenue of the chain. 

However, what about security, you may ask? Since the entire purpose of the issuance was to provide high incentive and therefore high security. Now here is the catch, the security is not compromised in any way. Itâ€™s like Proof of Stake is a highly efficient way of providing security. We will cover Proof of stake in another article in detail. However a quick brief, in the proof of stake consensus mechanism, miners do not need to run expensive hardware and incur high electricity costs for mining ETH. Instead, they can just stake their ETH and become a validator. It essentially significantly reduces the cost to mine ETH and therefore the entire cost of security to ETH reduces.

**The Positive Flywheel!**

As discussed before, with more and more dapps deployed on Ethereum, the demand for Ethereum block space increases. This implies high gas fees which in turn implies high gas burn. Reduction in supply means increasing ETH prices. Higher ETH prices create draw even higher interest and demand. At the same time, increased incentive increases security as well which increases its utility again! This positive flywheel further improves the profitability of the blockchain in the long run. I am really excited to witness the post-merge era! Are you?

title: Truly, WTF is a DAO?
body:
Bet youâ€™ve heard a LOT about DAO within the last couple of months. Most people first encountered DAOs through the ConstitutionDAO which was looking to buy the US Constitution, crazy right? Most blockchain skeptics first thought is â€œAnother 3 Letter abbreviation?â€ well Yes but this time we are coming for your job.Â  
 

#### Truly WTF is aÂ DAO?

Seems like everyone has got a different Explanation for DAOs. Hereâ€™s ours, in a pretty truthful and â€œexplain like Iâ€™m 5â€ Way.Â 

DAOs are Decentralized Autonomous Organizations, already that's a mouth full but give me a minute, DAOs happen when a group of people with a common goal, Mission and Vision come together to achieve it in a decentralized way. We removed as many buzzwords as possible. A common meme definition is a group chat with a shared Crypto wallet.Â 

Imagine you are a Drake fan, which we expect you to be, then you gather yourself and a bunch of friends who are also die-hards together and say the goal of this DAO is to have at least one member of the DAO in every Drake show no matter where in the world it is.Â 

So you create some form of chat and decide to pull together your crypto resources to fund every Trip. You build the Site in public and do everything transparently and everyone has the right to vote for who gets to represent the DAO in every show based on the Amount contributed.Â 

In its simplest and most basic form, this is a DAO. Yes it can get complicated and instead of going to shows youâ€™re investing in protocols and need lawyers in the DAO, dev, designers, a balanced governance model, and a lot more other things

 
 

> DAOs are Decentralized Autonomous Organizations

#### Are DAOs 100% Decentralized?

To be honest, most DAOs arenâ€™t 100% decentralized, Voice has listed over 150 DAOs and the trend remains the same, thereâ€™s always some sort of path to centralization of the DAO by a Whale.Â 

Some DAOs have a set of people who make the decisions, yes they have snapshot voting and sometimes allow only stakers to vote and all that cool stuff but at its core, there are â€œmajorâ€ decision-makers. Now, this isnâ€™t bad, if everyone was a major decision member then the DAO will be going nowhere, so yes this is a good thing. In our opinion DAOs shouldnâ€™t be 100% Decentralized but about 70% decentralized making it that the â€œmajorâ€ decision-makers are trustworthy people.Â 

#### Is DAOs Autonomous?

 
 

Ummm... No, The common ideology is the Uber DAO, where it runs fully autonomous no human interaction is still very much a Dream, Most DAOs preach Community so do we want it fully autonomous? No, we definitely donâ€™t we need to keep it real DAOs are all about community and shouldnâ€™t be fully run by code, maybe funds should be managed by an Autonomous smart contract but every other thing needs to be run by the community.

DAOs equal Community!

 
 

#### Are DAOs an Organizations?

 
 

Well yes, they are. Well, more on the community side than organization but let's stick to that.

Bet you understand what DAOs are now but now the question is why? Why should they even exist?

Simply put Ownership, freedom, and working on what you love. DAOs are the gateway to long-term wealth where builders and value creators get rewarded and the others? well, are left to speculate. DAOs are even playing field for everyone where talent speaks volumes and graduating from Harvard doesnâ€™tÂ 

The girl from a slump in Nigeria has got an equivalent playing field as the Dude who graduated from Harvard as long as they both have a laptop, internet connection, a Discord account, and use [Voice](https://voice.softr.app/). **Equality!**

 
 

#### 

#### Why should you Contribute/ work for aÂ DAO?

Imagine having the ability to contribute to both Discord code base and Google's Codebase, they arenâ€™t competitors so there really shouldnâ€™t be a problem, In the current web2 world you get fired in the web3 DAO-filled world youâ€™re loved by both DAOs!

You get the freedom to choose what you want to work on and at what time. DAOs offer you flexibility where youâ€™re rewarded according to the value-added over time Spent.Â 

## DAOs Have the Ultimate working conditions!

Working/Contributing to a DAO is a mix of Working, Learning, Networking, comfort, and having fun it's the â€œperfectâ€ balance. Google gives you free lunch but you are constantly networking with Smart people and meeting new people in the Server/group.Â 

Now we know what youâ€™re thinking where can I start my DAO journey???

Voice is your go-to place, we help you Discover, Contribute and Go Full-time on DAOs, No hassles.

title: Individual and DAO's Win-Win Strategies for Growth | Talk about DAO 0x01
body:
> å›½å†…ç”¨æˆ·è¯·åŠ å¾®ä¿¡ï¼š19726581
>
> Authors: `leeduckgo`,`msfew`

The Talk about DAO section is a collection of NonceGeek's thoughts on the practice of DAO.

A Brief Analysis of the Relationship between Individuals and Organizations

In any kind of organization, the relationship between individual and organization is a very important topic that deserves deep consideration.

First of all, let's analyze the state of the organization.

Applying the concept of game theory, the game relationship between organization and individual can be divided into three kinds as follows.

* Zero-sum game: the organization creates very little new value, and the organization is only a "middleman" for the realization of individual labor value. At the same time, in order to maintain the organization itself, it also needs to take part of the value of individual labor as "commission".
* Negative sum game: The organization is going downhill. This is a very difficult time for both the organization and the individual. Many times the organization will even suppress the individuals, typically by withholding wages from employees.
* Positive game: The overall development is active.

It seems that, as individuals, we can choose the organization that is in a "positive-sum state" and be done with it.

But when you think about it, it doesn't seem so simple.

Let's consider two dimensions - the 'revenue dimension' and the 'growth dimension' - and we can get two tables.

```
+--------------------------------------------------+
|               Earnings Table                     |
+--------------------------------------------------+
|            |   Satisfaction  | Dissatisfaction   |
+--------------------------------------------------+
| Individual |                 |                   |
+--------------------------------------------------+
| Org        |                 |                   |
+--------------------------------------------------+

+--------------------------------------------------+
|                 Growth Table                     |
+--------------------------------------------------+
|            |   Satisfaction  | Dissatisfaction   |
+--------------------------------------------------+
| Individual |                 |                   |
+--------------------------------------------------+
| Org        |                 |                   |
+--------------------------------------------------+
```

Many companies in a "positive state" are able to achieve win-win on the revenue table, and both individuals and organizations are satisfied with their revenue.

However, the most difficult part of the entire narrative is the win-win of the growth table, which is often the most neglected.

Short-term consistency and long-term uncertainty between individual and organizational growth in organizations

In many cases, personal growth and organizational growth may be consistent in the short term, but they are uncertain in the long term. For example, a fresh graduate will join a suitable organization for high growth; at the same time, the fresh graduate will inject "fresh blood" into the organization.

However, in the long run, there may be differences in the direction and speed of growth between individuals and organizations.

Traditional organizations have cumbersome mechanisms for joining and exiting, so when such differences arise, they either have to live with it or go their separate ways.

However, the DAO format gives a solution to this paradox -- ideally, anyone in the organization has the right to afk (away from keyboard: temporarily leave) and btk (back to keyboard: come back) at any time.

In this case, even if the development of the individual is not in line with the development of the organization, then it only needs to afk, no need to report to anyone; when you want to develop with the organization, just btk back to participate in organizational activities.

**In other words, the decision to join, work and quit in a traditional organization is in the hands of the organization, but a real DAO will return this right to the individual. Through this "power transfer", can we truly create a win-win strategy for individuals and organizations?**

title: Notes on Tanu Malakul Na Ayudhaya
body:
*Celebrating the work of 1938 Bangkok born artist Tanu Malakul Na Ayudhaya, a fifth generation artist of the Malakul family, whose artistic heritage dates back to the reign of King Rama II. Tanu Malakul, a former professor of art at the Bangkok Academy of Arts, offers a colorful feast and inspiring graphic style for the eye on NFTs.*

![Tanu Malakul Na Ayudhaya by Peter Nitsch.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/cYYJMj_be47aE8_KqoQfy.jpg?height=1642&width=1086&&&&&size=medium)

**Notes on Tanu Malakul Na Ayudhaya by Sidhijai Tanphiphat (1987)**

Tanu Malakulâ€™s artistic talent was recognized by the late Prof. Silpa Bhirasri (C. Filoci), an Italian who took up Thai citizenship and is largely regarded as the father of the Western arts movement in Thailand. Tanu Malakul was persuaded by Prof. Bhirasri to study under him at the Fine Arts University in Bangkok from 1959 to 1962.

He then furthered his studies at the Berlin Academy of Arts (S.H.F.B.K., Berlin) graduating in industrial design under the tutelage of Prof. Dr. Braun Feldweg Tanu took that opportunity to travel widely in Europe. The exposure to foreign cultures, arts and philosophy is an important step in the formative years of any budding artist as it was to Tanu Malakul.

Upon his return to Thailand in 1968, Tanu Malakul joined an industrial manufacturing conglomerate, Siam Cement Company Limited, as an industrial designer. During this period, he continued to experiment with various art styles, techniques and media and produced works which found many grateful collectors.

![Potplants in the Rain I](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/B8P4C0Td5FieH9v2hFeCI.jpg?height=914&width=1073&&&&size=medium)

His commitment to arts became total in 1972 when Tanu Malakul decided to forsake the promising corporate career and became a full time and freelance artist, a doubtful occupation at best where fame and fortune is almost unheard of in Thailand. His instincts prevailed, however. During this period of the early Seventies, Tanu Malakul was deeply concerned with the universal problems of the rapidly deteriorating environment â€“ particularly in Thailand where deforestation and the destruction of watersheds and ecological balance was starkly apparent. His work mostly in oil, expressed in abstract hard edged graphic style, inter-mixed with surreal scenes sought to dramatize the need for environmental conservation and for a more rational balance between technological and economic quests.

As a painter who has seriously experimented with surrealism and impressionism of the western contemporary styles, the traditional Thai mural painting technique became increasingly fascinating to Tanu Malakul as a means for conveying and expressing more complex concepts and themes.

![Concrete Incarnation, 1972](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/pzGGE-KNSGhbaquzQaStK.jpg?height=1115&width=1100&&&&size=medium)

Thai mural paintings executed on the interior walls of Thai Buddhist temples are mainly used to explain the teachings of the Lord Buddha to the illiterate laymen and also to illustrate important events of the Buddhist religion. Thai mural painting techniques do not adhere to the principles of perspectives and vanishing points.

Scenes often appear at equidistance to the observer ingeniously separated by trees or rocks which allow the various scenes to blend in. As such, a painting may encompass different times of the day â€“ day and night â€“ one subject may appear in different scenes of the same painting as the story unfolds, and more importantly, and object, such as a building may be portrayed as seen from 3 different directions, which is what cubism is to the western art. Such imaginative application of abstraction renders the traditional Thai mural painting techniques a powerful tool with which an artist can portray complicated stories, themes or to express complex concepts. This is what has attracted Tanu Malakul to study and apply Thai mural painting techniques to the bulk of his works.

![Once Upon a Time, 1985.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vRWQqBWMnAIrLZMIFTATz.jpg?height=1568&width=1200&&&&size=medium)

From the mid-Nineteen Seventies onward, Tanu Malakul totally immersed himself in experimenting with traditional Thai mural painting techniques. Mostly working in acrylic on canvas. Early works ranged from his own interpretation and portrayal of classic Buddhist events such as when the Prince Siddharta recognized the futility of worldly sufferings to search for eternal peace and to eventually find enlightenment, including everyday life scenes of the early Bangkok period and other such down to earth subjects. This became an extremely prolific period although Thai paintings by nature required painstaking attention to detail to all parts of the paintings ranging from such operations as application of gold leaves and clearly outlining every object in the painting.

Inquisitive by nature, Tanu Malakul continues to study ideas, philosophies, theories and new scientific discoveries of subjects ranging from Buddhist scriptures (Tripitaka) to the theories and discoveries of modern quantum physics, cosmology and many other challenging topics.

![The Great Existance, 1982.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/mYKGzWiCeIRDjIlyalyTX.jpg?height=1457&width=1100&&&size=medium)

Tanu Malakul has developed an intriguing view that the teachings of the Lord Buddha have understood many of the natural phenomena that modern science has recently begun to explain.

For eight long years, Tanu Malakul has been conceptualizing in his mind a painting in which the relationship between the minutest elements such as a drop of water to the infinite universe and to show that such metamorphoses are consistent with the Buddhist view of the same. What were mere sketches made in the early Seventies which he was unable to develop further with Western or contemporary painting techniques suddenly became plausible in 1982 when Tanu Malakulâ€™s mastery of the incredible techniques of Thai mural painting was near total. A series of three paintings depicting the birth, enlightenment and death of the Lord Buddha are regarded easily as his most important works.

This same series of work culminated in the very large painting â€šThe Four Noble Truths' which encompassed the total concepts and contents of the aforementioned three paintings.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/1fZ5OnvMix-SrGUFH7pEq.jpg?height=1101&width=1442&&&&size=medium)

Detractors of contemporary artists working in the traditional mural painting style have contended that such artists are regressing to the past and are simply copying old subject matters and techniques. While this may be true of much of such works today, but Tanu Malakul, by virtue of his thorough understanding of the techniques of Thai painting and the social context in which the techniques were developed historically, have found new applications for it in modern times that no other Thai artist has.

![Finished portrait work in Tanu Malakul's studio, 2022.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/tRBweKCvhgKeHrpYHhijN.jpg?height=900&width=1200&&size=medium)

Apart from such â€šheavy' subjects as above mentioned, Tanu Malakul has a keen sense for appreciating the utility and beauty of all kinds of objects. He has designed and executed numerous graphic silkscreen prints for hotel wall decorations as well as hand painted furnitures, screens, table lamps and such objects d'art.

![Left: Goldfish, Right: Potplants III](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/uXgUb7bgYOZawwA_N6Vm2.jpg?height=936&width=1500&&&&size=medium)

Paradoxically, Tanu Malakul is a virtual recluse regarding the publicizing of his work, be they for commercial or for public recognition purposes, and yet he is not an introverted person. Still as a full-time artist, Tanu Malakul has not held even one exhibition of his work because his work is almost always executed upon commission.

![Potplants in the Rain II](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3RK6EGiadbmN3dMi5b3R-.jpg?height=682&width=782&&&&size=medium)

This became an extremely prolific period although Thai paintings by nature required painstaking attention to detail to all parts of the paintings ranging from such operations as application of gold leaves and clearly outlining every object in the painting.

Inquisitive by nature, Tanu Malakul continues to study ideas, philosophies, theories and new scientific discoveries of subjects ranging from Buddhist scriptures (Tripitaka) to the theories and discoveries of modern quantum physics, cosmology and many other challenging topics.

Tanu Malakul has developed an intriguing view that the teachings of the Lord Buddha have understood many of the natural phenomena that modern science has recently begun to explain.

For eight long years, Tanu Malakul has been conceptualizing in his mind a painting in which the relationship between the minutest elements such as a drop of water to the infinite universe and to show that such metamorphoses are consistent with the Buddhist view of the same. A series of three paintings depicting the birth, enlightenment and death of the Lord Buddha are regarded easily as his most important works.

This same series of work culminated in the very large painting â€šThe Four Noble Truths' which encompassed the total concepts and contents of the aforementioned three paintings.

Detractors of contemporary artists working in the traditional mural painting style have contended that such artists are regressing to the past and are simply copying old subject matters and techniques. Apart from such â€šheavy' subjects as above mentioned, Tanu Malakul has a keen sense for appreciating the utility and beauty of all kinds of objects. ![Left: Goldfish, Right: Potplants III](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/uXgUb7bgYOZawwA_N6Vm2.jpg?height=936&width=1500&&&&size=medium)

title: Is Ethereum profitable? - A deep dive on Ethereum Business Model
body:
The market capital of Bitcoin at the time of writing this article is around USD 400 Bn with a â€œBâ€. Itâ€™s down from its peak market capitalization of USD 1.27 Tn. While market capital of Ethereum is approximately USD 150 Bn down from USD 500 Bn. To put things in perspective, Google has a market capitalization of USD 1.4 Tn and the entire GDP of India is around USD 2.6 Tn the 5th largest GDP in the world.

In short, Bitcoin and Ethereum market caps are HUGE! Google, Amazon, Facebook everyone sells amazing products have earned billions in revenue to attain such valuation and, in turn, market capitalization. But what does Blockchain sell? What is their business model? Are these profitable? Letâ€™s explore the answer to these questions in todayâ€™s post.

**Blockchains are in the business of selling block space.**

Blockchains generally have a limited about of block space. The higher the demand for blockspace, the higher the charges (fees) to use the blockspace. Simple, supply-demand dynamics at play. Now, why do people want to use this block space? Whatâ€™s so special about them? How is it different than a single computer? This block space can be used to record information, run code, and transfer things (currency, digital objects). Itâ€™s a trustless, immutable, decentralized, and permissionless blockspace. It means, ideally, no one can alter or censor anything. This is often expressed via a single term â€œsecurityâ€. Needless to say, security is the most important component. If it is compromised, the block space is not worth much. Therefore, the higher the security, the more valuable the blockspace. Security is essentially derived from independent miners/validators. High decentralization and high miners/validators mean higher security. Miners/validators are similar to employees of the blockchain enabling the ecosystem and ensuring security.

So, letâ€™s see the business model of Ethereum!

Profit = Revenue - Cost

**Revenue â†’** Simply the transaction fees earned by the system. The fees users are willing to pay to use the blockspace. This revenue varies and is dependent on the demand. Over the last year, daily revenue ranged from $4 Mn - $80 Mn! On average around $10-$15 Mn per day!

With EIP-1559, a significant chunk of the fees is burned. When itâ€™s burned, it is kind of equivalent to stock buybacks which adds values to the stocks or in this case coins.

**Burn â†’** Approximately 0.17x of ETH issued currently is burned. This is not a fixed amount and depends on a number of factors. This reduces the supply of ETH in the system. It is interesting to note that this is the primary mechanism of transferring value directly to ETH holders aside from an indirect mechanism of an increase in token value.

Therefore actual revenue of the system is transaction fees - eth burned

**Cost â†’** Fees paid to miners/validators

Currently in a Proof of Work mechanism, Ethereum issues \~4% to miners/validators as a block incentive reward. This incentive is necessary to attract a large number of miners/validators and therefore higher security. This amounts to a total of \~ $32Mn worth of Eth issuance every day.

Clearly, the Ethereum business model is not profitable currently. Itâ€™s similar to a new startup or company which runs promotional campaigns in order to attract network participants. However, the good thing is it soon will be profitable!

With Ethereum migrating to Proof of Stake, the issuance will reduce by 90%! Therefore, its issuance cost post-merge is around $3 Mn. This is less than Ethereum's current average revenue! Therefore, Ethereum will become a profitable business model with a profit margin of \~75%!Â Of course, with continuous innovations, the use cases Ethereum can support will increase. This will further increase the demand and therefore the revenue of the chain.

However, what about security, you may ask? Since the entire purpose of the issuance was to provide high incentive and therefore high security. Now here is the catch, the security is not compromised in any way. Itâ€™s like Proof of Stake is a highly efficient way of providing security. We will cover Proof of stake in another article in detail. However a quick brief, in the proof of stake consensus mechanism, miners do not need to run expensive hardware and incur high electricity costs for mining ETH. Instead, they can just stake their ETH and become a validator. It essentially significantly reduces the cost to mine ETH and therefore the entire cost of security to ETH reduces.

**The Positive Flywheel!**

As discussed before, with more and more dapps deployed on Ethereum, the demand for Ethereum block space increases. This implies high gas fees which in turn implies high gas burn. Reduction in supply means increasing ETH prices. Higher ETH prices draw even higher interest and demand. At the same time, increased incentive increases security as well which increases its utility again! This positive flywheel further improves the profitability of the blockchain in the long run. I am really excited to witness the post-merge era! Are you?

title: Notes on Tanu Malakul Na Ayudhaya
body:
### Celebrating the work of 1938 Bangkok born artist Tanu Malakul Na Ayudhaya, a fifth generation artist of the Malakul family, whose artistic heritage dates back to the reign of King Rama II. Tanu Malakul, a former professor of art at the Bangkok Academy of Arts, offers a colorful feast and inspiring graphic style for the eye on NFTs.

![Tanu Malakul Na Ayudhaya by Peter Nitsch.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/cYYJMj_be47aE8_KqoQfy.jpg?height=1642&width=1086&&&&&size=medium)

**Notes on Tanu Malakul Na Ayudhaya by Sidhijai Tanphiphat (1987)**

Tanu Malakulâ€™s artistic talent was recognized by the late Prof. Silpa Bhirasri (C. Filoci), an Italian who took up Thai citizenship and is largely regarded as the father of the Western arts movement in Thailand. Tanu Malakul was persuaded by Prof. Bhirasri to study under him at the Fine Arts University in Bangkok from 1959 to 1962.

He then furthered his studies at the Berlin Academy of Arts (S.H.F.B.K., Berlin) graduating in industrial design under the tutelage of Prof. Dr. Braun Feldweg Tanu took that opportunity to travel widely in Europe. The exposure to foreign cultures, arts and philosophy is an important step in the formative years of any budding artist as it was to Tanu Malakul.

Upon his return to Thailand in 1968, Tanu Malakul joined an industrial manufacturing conglomerate, Siam Cement Company Limited, as an industrial designer. During this period, he continued to experiment with various art styles, techniques and media and produced works which found many grateful collectors.

![Potplants in the Rain I](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/B8P4C0Td5FieH9v2hFeCI.jpg?height=914&width=1073&&&&size=medium)

His commitment to arts became total in 1972 when Tanu Malakul decided to forsake the promising corporate career and became a full time and freelance artist, a doubtful occupation at best where fame and fortune is almost unheard of in Thailand. His instincts prevailed, however. During this period of the early Seventies, Tanu Malakul was deeply concerned with the universal problems of the rapidly deteriorating environment â€“ particularly in Thailand where deforestation and the destruction of watersheds and ecological balance was starkly apparent. His work mostly in oil, expressed in abstract hard edged graphic style, inter-mixed with surreal scenes sought to dramatize the need for environmental conservation and for a more rational balance between technological and economic quests.

As a painter who has seriously experimented with surrealism and impressionism of the western contemporary styles, the traditional Thai mural painting technique became increasingly fascinating to Tanu Malakul as a means for conveying and expressing more complex concepts and themes.

![Concrete Incarnation, 1972](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/pzGGE-KNSGhbaquzQaStK.jpg?height=1115&width=1100&&&&size=medium)

Thai mural paintings executed on the interior walls of Thai Buddhist temples are mainly used to explain the teachings of the Lord Buddha to the illiterate laymen and also to illustrate important events of the Buddhist religion. Thai mural painting techniques do not adhere to the principles of perspectives and vanishing points.

Scenes often appear at equidistance to the observer ingeniously separated by trees or rocks which allow the various scenes to blend in. As such, a painting may encompass different times of the day â€“ day and night â€“ one subject may appear in different scenes of the same painting as the story unfolds, and more importantly, and object, such as a building may be portrayed as seen from 3 different directions, which is what cubism is to the western art. Such imaginative application of abstraction renders the traditional Thai mural painting techniques a powerful tool with which an artist can portray complicated stories, themes or to express complex concepts. This is what has attracted Tanu Malakul to study and apply Thai mural painting techniques to the bulk of his works.

![Once Upon a Time, 1985.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vRWQqBWMnAIrLZMIFTATz.jpg?height=1568&width=1200&&&&size=medium)

From the mid-Nineteen Seventies onward, Tanu Malakul totally immersed himself in experimenting with traditional Thai mural painting techniques. Mostly working in acrylic on canvas. Early works ranged from his own interpretation and portrayal of classic Buddhist events such as when the Prince Siddharta recognized the futility of worldly sufferings to search for eternal peace and to eventually find enlightenment, including everyday life scenes of the early Bangkok period and other such down to earth subjects. This became an extremely prolific period although Thai paintings by nature required painstaking attention to detail to all parts of the paintings ranging from such operations as application of gold leaves and clearly outlining every object in the painting.

Inquisitive by nature, Tanu Malakul continues to study ideas, philosophies, theories and new scientific discoveries of subjects ranging from Buddhist scriptures (Tripitaka) to the theories and discoveries of modern quantum physics, cosmology and many other challenging topics.

![The Great Existance, 1982.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/mYKGzWiCeIRDjIlyalyTX.jpg?height=1457&width=1100&&&size=medium)

Tanu Malakul has developed an intriguing view that the teachings of the Lord Buddha have understood many of the natural phenomena that modern science has recently begun to explain.

For eight long years, Tanu Malakul has been conceptualizing in his mind a painting in which the relationship between the minutest elements such as a drop of water to the infinite universe and to show that such metamorphoses are consistent with the Buddhist view of the same. What were mere sketches made in the early Seventies which he was unable to develop further with Western or contemporary painting techniques suddenly became plausible in 1982 when Tanu Malakulâ€™s mastery of the incredible techniques of Thai mural painting was near total. A series of three paintings depicting the birth, enlightenment and death of the Lord Buddha are regarded easily as his most important works.

This same series of work culminated in the very large painting â€šThe Four Noble Truths' which encompassed the total concepts and contents of the aforementioned three paintings.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/1fZ5OnvMix-SrGUFH7pEq.jpg?height=1101&width=1442&&&&size=medium)

Detractors of contemporary artists working in the traditional mural painting style have contended that such artists are regressing to the past and are simply copying old subject matters and techniques. While this may be true of much of such works today, but Tanu Malakul, by virtue of his thorough understanding of the techniques of Thai painting and the social context in which the techniques were developed historically, have found new applications for it in modern times that no other Thai artist has.

![Finished portrait work in Tanu Malakul's studio, 2022.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/tRBweKCvhgKeHrpYHhijN.jpg?height=900&width=1200&&size=medium)

Apart from such â€šheavy' subjects as above mentioned, Tanu Malakul has a keen sense for appreciating the utility and beauty of all kinds of objects. He has designed and executed numerous graphic silkscreen prints for hotel wall decorations as well as hand painted furnitures, screens, table lamps and such objects d'art.

Still as a full-time artist, Tanu Malakul has not held even one exhibition of his work because his work is almost always executed upon commission.

Therefore, Ethereum will become a profitable business model with a profit margin of \~75%!Â Of course, with continuous innovations, the use cases Ethereum can support will increase. This will further increase the demand and therefore the revenue of the chain.

However, what about security, you may ask? Since the entire purpose of the issuance was to provide high incentive and therefore high security. Now here is the catch, the security is not compromised in any way. Itâ€™s like Proof of Stake is a highly efficient way of providing security. We will cover Proof of stake in another article in detail. However a quick brief, in the proof of stake consensus mechanism, miners do not need to run expensive hardware and incur high electricity costs for mining ETH. Instead, they can just stake their ETH and become a validator. It essentially significantly reduces the cost to mine ETH and therefore the entire cost of security to ETH reduces.

**The Positive Flywheel!**

As discussed before, with more and more dapps deployed on Ethereum, the demand for Ethereum block space increases. This implies high gas fees which in turn implies high gas burn. Reduction in supply means increasing ETH prices. Higher ETH prices draw even higher interest and demand. At the same time, increased incentive increases security as well which increases its utility again! This positive flywheel further improves the profitability of the blockchain in the long run. I am really excited to witness the post-merge era! Are you?
