In March, MicroStrategy [borrowed ](https://www.microstrategy.com/en/investor-relations/press/silvergate-bank-issues-205-m-loan-to-macrostrategy-collateralized-by-bitcoin_03-29-2022)$205 million against its own Bitcoin, to buy â€“ you guessed it â€“ more Bitcoin.

Saylor is now another ex-billionaire, *Forbes* estimates, worth a little over $700 million. MicroStrategyâ€™s stock is down 56% since early March, compared to the Nasdaq indexâ€™s 14% dip over the same period. But Saylor hasnâ€™t sold any of his precious Bitcoinâ€”â€œnot a satoshiâ€, he told *CNN* anchor Julia Chatterley this week, invoking a little-known term for Bitcoinâ€™s smallest unit. (One satoshi is worth 0.00000001 BTC.)

â€œBitcoin is going to outlast all of us,â€ Saylor insisted. â€œIâ€™m quite sure of that.â€

title: Morgan Creek Is Trying to Counter FTXâ€™s BlockFi Bailout, Leaked Call Shows
body:
Cryptocurrency investment firm Morgan Creek Digital is attempting to raise $250 million from investors to purchase a majority stake in crypto lender BlockFi, a leaked investor call from Tuesday reveals.

Morgan Creekâ€™s plan to rapidly assemble an equity offer was hatched in response to crypto exchange FTXâ€™s Tuesday morning announcement that it would extend a [$250 million credit line](https://www.coindesk.com/business/2022/06/21/blockfi-receives-250m-credit-facility-from-ftx/) to BlockFi.

Morgan Creek Digital declined to comment. A person with knowledge of the effort said there are multiple venture capital funds that are exploring ways to provide equity financing to BlockFi as the lender struggles to stay afloat.

At stake is the ability of BlockFiâ€™s existing shareholders, including longtime backer Morgan Creek, to recoup their investments.

â€œIâ€™ve been making calls all day,â€ Morgan Creek Digital managing partner Mark Yusko said on the leaked call.

According to Yusko, the FTX credit line proposal had a catch for BlockFiâ€™s existing shareholders: It gave FTX the option to buy BlockFi â€œat essentially zero price.â€ If FTX were to exercise said option, it would effectively wipe out all of BlockFiâ€™s existing equity shareholders, including management and employees with stock options, as well as all equity investors in the companyâ€™s previous venture rounds.

However, Yusko said on the leaked call that BlockFi founders Zac Prince and Flori Marquez had a valid reason for preliminarily accepting the terms: Of the several emergency financing offers BlockFi received, FTXâ€™s was the only one that would not subordinate client assets to the rescuer.

In other words, unless BlockFi went with FTX, its depositors would have had to wait in line behind the new lender to be repaid. Additionally, BlockFi had not received any equity financing options at that stage. (Yusko did not identify any of the other firms that proposed bailout packages for BlockFi.)

***Read more: [BlockFi Receives $250M Credit Facility From FTX](https://www.coindesk.com/business/2022/06/21/blockfi-receives-250m-credit-facility-from-ftx/)***

BlockFi CEO Prince [tweeted](https://twitter.com/BlockFiZac/status/1539216594383028224?s=20&t=Xm_oJsv2PjecTEKO6SUlJA) on June 21 that the company had signed a preliminary term sheet with FTX. Yusko told investors on the leaked call that day that FTX and BlockFi were â€œprobably three days away from signing a definitive agreement.â€

â€œWe are still negotiating the terms of the deal and cannot share more information at this time,â€ a BlockFi spokesperson told CoinDesk on Saturday. â€œWe anticipate sharing more on the terms of the deal with the public at a later date.â€ FTX did not respond to requests for comment by press time.

According to Yusko on the leaked call, in the event that FTX exercised its option after extending the credit line, only investors in the most senior tranche of the companyâ€™s latest raise would get back anything, and even that would amount to pennies on the dollar.

Morgan Creek, which participated in several funding rounds for BlockFi, would be among those holding the bag.

â€œThe only alternative is to raise an equivalent amount in equity and thatâ€™s what weâ€™re working on,â€ Yusko told investors on the call. â€œI would say it's a 10% possibility but not zero.â€

A recording of the call, which CoinDesk reviewed, offers a rare window into the closed-door negotiations to rescue BlockFi, one of the crypto industryâ€™s largest lenders, amid a meltdown in the digital asset and broader financial markets. It also shows how the current turbulence echoes past financial crises, with Yusko comparing FTXâ€™s rescue package to [J. Pierpont Morganâ€™s bailout of the Knickerbocker Trust in 1907](https://www.federalreservehistory.org/essays/panic-of-1907).

Indeed, Wall Street firm Goldman Sachs has been [trying to organize an investor group](https://www.coindesk.com/business/2022/06/24/goldman-sachs-raising-funds-to-buy-celsius-assets-sources/) to scoop up assets of another troubled crypto lender, Celsius Network, at steep discounts in the event that company files for bankruptcy.

***Read more: [Goldman Sachs Leading Investor Group to Buy Celsius Assets: Sources](https://www.coindesk.com/business/2022/06/24/goldman-sachs-raising-funds-to-buy-celsius-assets-sources/)***

On Friday, the Wall Street Journal [reported](https://www.wsj.com/articles/crypto-exchange-ftx-in-talks-to-acquire-stake-in-blockfi-11656083179) that FTX was in talks to acquire an equity stake in BlockFi. It is unclear whether new developments since Tuesday have substantially changed negotiations.

When asked by an investor on the call, Yusko said Morgan Creek would be open to an â€œin-between dealâ€ where FTX (led by billionaire Sam Bankman-Fried) and Morgan Creek both put up a portion of the capital.

â€œI will definitely try to pursue \[a joint deal\],â€ said Yusko. â€œNot that I have SBF on speed-dial, but I could probably get that call.â€

Yusko said that he spoke with one potential lead investor that could write a $100 million check, as well as two other investors who â€œexpressed interestâ€ and could write checks up to $50 million.

Morgan Creek Digital, co-founded by Anthony â€œPompâ€ Pompliano, is one of BlockFiâ€™s largest investors. The firm has participated in BlockFiâ€™s Series A through D fundraising rounds across three funds and a special purpose vehicle (SPV), a type of investment structure that allows an investor to invest in a single company.

Yusko cautioned that while Morgan Creek was doing all it could to salvage its investment in BlockFi, success was far from assured.

â€œIt's not over, but it is definitely looking dark,â€ he said.

title: STORE SAFELY YOUR CRYPTOCURRENCY
body:
In order to store your crypto you have to buy (obtain) them first.

You could do it in several ways like a P2P transfer (from someone else throw a transaction using just the blockchain network) or using an exchange (the most popular and simple way).

After you have your crypto coins you need to store them, so you need a wallet.

There are 2 major types of wallets: *CUSTODIAL* and *NONCUSTODIAL.*

With *custodial wallets* someone else is in control of your wallet, the respective marketplace (the exchange usually) stores and secures your coins, it could sell your founds in an unpredictable and critical event or, in case of a marketplace hack, you could lose a part of your money (or even all of it). This happen when you buy through exchanges. These wallets are usually **hot wallets** (your coins are stored online) owned by the exchange.

On the other side, there are *noncustodial* *wallets*, that means you are the only one responsible for the usage of your coins, you store and secure them using ***SOFTWER/HOT*** wallets or ***HARDWARE/COLD*** wallets.

A HOT WALLET has a connection to the internet and it includes applications in order to be used. You could also may need an extension added to your network that store your money. Basically, instead of having a physical wallet, you have one on the internet. The hot wallet is believed to be secure, because it has a good level of security. When you create this wallet you have to set up a password or a pin and after that you will get 12 random words that are your â€˜recovery keyâ€™. You are the only one who control the wallet with that words. In case you lose it, you will never be able to access your wallet again. Your money will be forever lost. If anyone has access to this key, she/he could stole your coins. This adds security to the custodianâ€™s wallet and also make the custodian more responsible. Some examples of HOT wallets are MetaMask, Trust Wallet, Binance Wallet.

A COLD WALLET has no connection to the internet. It is a physically device that helps you store your coins. Being something that do not have only an online connection, it is consider to be more secure. The process is simple in theory: you buy the coins and send them to an address (for example, using an exchange) that correspond with the hardware wallet address through an app. In practice it is a little more complicated, but **Ledger Wallet** make it simple. 

\#You buy your Ledger device first. 

\#You will get an **USB cable** and a **device** (that is really small and have only 2 buttons, you press both of them to confirm an operation and one of them to navigate) that can be *connected to your computer using the USB*.

\#You will install **Ledger Live app** and open it. 

\#After connecting the device to the computer, you will have some instructions to follow, that will be shown to you on the Ledger device screen, follow them carefully. You will have to set up **a pin code** and then you will recieve ***24 random words that are your recovery key***. 

\#Write them down (you could use the paper that ledger device acquisition provides to you, or something else) Â and never share them, they are your recovery key. 

\#You will have to check if you save the words right through the app: after you recieve them, the next step is *to verify if you can put them in the correct order, using the device.*

Other cold wallet is Trezor.

COLD wallets are so important because they can not be hacked and give you the control of your coins, making them to be store in a secure manner.

For example, an exchange like Coinbase officially admitted that if the company were to file for bankruptcy, the court might treat customer assets, that the exchange is custodian for, as Coinbaseâ€™s assets. And theyâ€™d be at the back of the line for repayment, forcing normal people, unaccustomed to the ins and outs of federal bankruptcy court, to claw back their money along with everybody else owed money by the exchange.. An exchange could also impose new rules that could affect you negatively, it has the power to list and delist coins anytime. Recently, the Coinbase exchange announced that the â€˜Coinbase proâ€™ version will cease to exist. The exchange said that â€˜Coinbase Proâ€™ will start sunsetting Coinbase Pro to migrate all advanced trading services into one unified Coinbase account. That was an unpredictable news and the users just have to do as the exchange said.

**So get your crypto off exchanges!**

title: Goldman Sachs Leading Investor Group to Buy Celsius Assets: Sources
body:
Goldman Sachs is looking to raise $2 billion from investors to buy up distressed assets from [troubled crypto lender](https://www.coindesk.com/business/2022/06/16/how-crypto-lender-celsius-overheated/) Celsius, according to two people familiar with the matter.

The proposed deal would allow investors to buy up Celsiusâ€™ assets at potentially big discounts in the event of a bankruptcy filing, the people said.

Goldman Sachs appears to be gauging interest and soliciting commitments from Web3 crypto funds, funds specializing in distressed assets and traditional financial institutions with ample cash on hand, according to a person familiar with the situation. The assets, most likely cryptocurrencies having to be sold on the cheap, would then likely be managed by participants in the fundraising push.

Celsius has tapped restructuring advisory firm Alvarez & Marsal, the Wall Street Journal [reported](https://www.wsj.com/articles/celsius-network-taps-more-advisers-to-prepare-for-potential-bankruptcy-11656088078?mod=Searchresults_pos1&page=1) Friday afternoon.

Goldman Sachs did not respond to a request for comment.

Celsius, which had more than $8 billion lent out to clients and $12 billion in assets under management as of [May of this year](https://www.coindesk.com/business/2022/06/16/how-crypto-lender-celsius-overheated/), abruptly announced on June 12 that it would stop withdrawals from its platform, citing â€œextreme market conditions.â€ The disclosure exacerbated those conditions, briefly sending bitcoinâ€™s price below $20,000.

In addition to hiring Alvarez & Marsal, Celsius has tapped restructuring attorneys from law firm Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld, the Wall Street Journal [reported](https://www.wsj.com/articles/crypto-lender-celsius-hires-restructuring-lawyers-after-account-freeze-11655250575) earlier this month. Global investment bank Citigroup has also been enlisted by Celsius to advise on possible solutions, including an assessment of an offer from rival crypto lender Nexo, [The Block reported](https://www.theblock.co/post/152230/citigroup-celsius-advising-after-withdrawal-freeze?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss).

Citigroup (C) and Akin Gump have both recommended Celsius file for bankruptcy, according to people familiar with the matter. Citigroup declined to comment. Akin Gump did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

Celsius [raised $750 million from investors last year](https://www.coindesk.com/business/2021/11/25/celsius-network-series-b-expands-to-750m-at-325b-valuation/), including Canadaâ€™s second-largest pension fund, Caisse de dÃ©pÃ´t et placement du QuÃ©bec (CDPQ), valuing the business at $3.25 billion.

title: Reasons Why You Should Wait For The M2 MacBook Air Instead of Buying The M2 MacBook Pro
body:
Apple launched the new M2-powered MacBook Air and MacBook Pro models earlier this year at its WWDC 2022 event. The new notebooks arrive with a plethora of changes and additions to enhance your user experience. While the M2 chip is common in both models of the MacBook, you have to consider various other factors before deciding which one to get. If you are looking to buy the latest offerings from Apple, there are a couple of aspects that you should take note of. Below are some of the reasons why you should wait for the new M2 MacBook Air instead of buying the M2 MacBook Pro.

## The M2 MacBook Air is a Brand New Machine With a Brand New Design and a Lot Going For it Compared to the M2 MacBook Pro

Before we move down to the points, take note that the MacBook Air and MacBook Pro models are both quite capable when it comes to processing power. Apple announced the new M2 chip this year that provides enhanced CPU and GPU capabilities. You can check out our reasons why the M2 MacBook Air is a better option compared to the M2 MacBook Pro.

**[RELATED STORY](https://wccftech.com/developer-makes-use-of-the-macbook-pro-notch-to-airdrop-files/)**[Ali Salman](https://wccftech.com/developer-makes-use-of-the-macbook-pro-notch-to-airdrop-files/)

[Developer Makes Use of the MacBook Pro Notch to AirDrop Files](https://wccftech.com/developer-makes-use-of-the-macbook-pro-notch-to-airdrop-files/)

**Design and Aesthetics**

One of the primary reasons why you should wait for the new M2 MacBook Air is the design and form factor. Apple ditched the wedged design this year and adopted a balanced approach. The new M2 MacBook Air now resembles the 14-inch and 16-inch MacBook Pro models. However, the notebook is quite thin in contrast to the 'Pro' models and it is also lightweight. If you are a student, the MacBook Air is a clear winner when it comes to portability.

**Display and Notch**

While the display quality is more or less similar on the M2 MacBook Air and MacBook Pro models, the prior comes with a notch. As mentioned earlier, the notch also contributes to a design that resembles last year's M1 Pro and M1 Max MacBook Pro models. The notch makes room for a bigger 13.6-inch display compared to the 13.3-inch display of the M2 MacBook Pro. Despite the bigger display, the MacBook Air is smaller in footprint compared to the MacBook Pro. This is because the Air features thinner bezels on all sides.

title: Fullvoting
body:
Fullvoting is an idea to combine **direct, representative and augmented voting for DAOs**.

Why?

1. To make better decisions
2. To increase the number of people who can effectively collaborate in decentralized organisations

Many DAOs such as ENS, BitDAO, Decentraland, Proof of Humanity and Uniswap use [Snapshot](http://snapshot.org) for off-chain voting.

These DAOs choose one or more [voting strategies](https://docs.snapshot.org/strategies/what-is-a-strategy) on Snapshot.

A voting strategy on Snapshot that would enable direct+representative+augmented voting would allow eth addresses to delegate to a URL. E.g. my-voting-provider.com/user

Then, the js code of the strategy would fetch something like my-voting-provider.com/user/space/proposal to know a vote.

These voting URLs would have no authentication. Anyone could see on my-voting-provider.com/USER/space/proposal would see the vote of the representative USER.

These URL voting providers are composable.

For example, provider1.com/BLUE could delegate to the following list:

1. provider1.com/A
2. provider1.com/B
3. provider2.com/C

In the previous example, provider1 could also let BLUE vote directly.

So if BLUE doesn't vote but A does, BLUE would vote as A regardless of B and C. If BLUE and A don't vote but B does, BLUE would vote as B regardless of C. But if B doesn't vote either, do as C says.

Consider that BLUE, A and B are from the same URL voting provider, but C doesn't.

This means that A and B can use delegation list + override like BLUE. But C, the last delegate from BLUE, is on a completely different provider.

This other URL voting provider could allow C to delegate to a list of all Nobel laureates or MIT neuroscientists. This provider could integrate with Wikidata/Wikipedia to confirm their occupation, alma mater and awards â€” like my old side project [agreelist.org](http://agreelist.org/)

Or this URL voting provider could be a16z which [already delegates half of their voting tokens](https://a16z.com/2021/08/26/open-sourcing-our-token-delegate-program).

Or one of the delegates on the URL voting provider could be AI-assisted or completely autonomous like [CÃ©sar Hidalgoâ€™s augmented democracy TED talk](https://www.ted.com/talks/cesar_hidalgo_a_bold_idea_to_replace_politicians).

To mitigate risks, delegations could end a few days before the direct voting.

And your URL voting provider could end AI-assisted delegates before human delegates.

That way people could always be alerted and override votes from delegates.

If we wish to enhance security even more, when an off-chain fullvoting period ends, we could have a period of time to get on-chain signatures. If enough signatures are gathered, the proposal could be voted via on-chain direct voting. This would be similar to Switzerlandâ€™s referendums where citizens ratify laws approved by politicians in a referendum if they gather enough signatures.

To sum up, if we implement direct+representative+augmented voting for DAOs we could:

1. Make better decisions
2. Increase the number of people who can effectively collaborate in decentralized organisations

And this is important because of what the MIT Professor Alex Pentland said:

> *The biggest problem in the world is not climate change, war or poverty, but how we organise among ourselves to make good decisions and carry them out.*

What do you think? Does it make sense? Should we build this?

If you think it is worth exploring, please reach me at [@arpahector](https://twitter.com/arpahector) or leave your email on [fullvoting.org](https://fullvoting.org/):

[https://fullvoting.org/](https://fullvoting.org/)

title: Fullvoting
body:
Fullvoting is an idea to combine **direct, representative and augmented voting for DAOs**.

Why?

1. To make better decisions
2. To increase the number of people who can effectively collaborate in decentralized organisations

Many DAOs such as ENS, BitDAO, Decentraland, Proof of Humanity and Uniswap use [Snapshot](http://snapshot.org) for off-chain voting.

These DAOs choose one or more [voting strategies](https://docs.snapshot.org/strategies/what-is-a-strategy) on Snapshot.

A voting strategy on Snapshot that would enable direct+representative+augmented voting would allow eth addresses to delegate to a URL. E.g. my-voting-provider.com/user

Then, the js code of the strategy would fetch something like my-voting-provider.com/user/space/proposal to know a vote.

These voting URLs would have no authentication. Anyone could see on my-voting-provider.com/USER/space/proposal would see the vote of the representative USER.

These URL voting providers are composable.

For example, provider1.com/BLUE could delegate to the following list:

1. provider1.com/A
2. provider1.com/B
3. provider2.com/C

In the previous example, provider1 could also let BLUE vote directly.

So if BLUE doesn't vote but A does, BLUE would vote as A regardless of B and C. If BLUE and A don't vote but B does, BLUE would vote as B regardless of C. But if B doesn't vote either, do as C says.

Consider that BLUE, A and B are from the same URL voting provider, but C doesn't.

This means that A and B can use delegation list + override like BLUE. But C, the last delegate from BLUE, is on a completely different provider.

This other URL voting provider could allow C to delegate to a list of all Nobel laureates or MIT neuroscientists. This provider could integrate with Wikidata/Wikipedia to confirm their occupation, alma mater and awards â€” like my old side project [agreelist.org](http://agreelist.org/)

Or this URL voting provider could be a16z which [already delegates half of their voting tokens](https://a16z.com/2021/08/26/open-sourcing-our-token-delegate-program).

Or one of the delegates on the URL voting provider could be AI-assisted or completely autonomous like [CÃ©sar Hidalgoâ€™s augmented democracy TED talk](https://www.ted.com/talks/cesar_hidalgo_a_bold_idea_to_replace_politicians).

To mitigate risks, off-chain delegations could end a few days before direct voting.

And your URL voting provider could end AI-assisted delegates before human delegates.

That way people could always be alerted and override votes from delegates.

To sum up, if we implement direct+representative+augmented voting for DAOs we could:

1. Make better decisions
2. Increase the number of people who can effectively collaborate in decentralized organisations

And this is important because of what the MIT Professor Alex Pentland said:

> *The biggest problem in the world is not climate change, war or poverty, but how we organise among ourselves to make good decisions and carry them out.*

What do you think? Does it make sense? Should we build this?

If you think it is worth exploring, please reach me at [@arpahector](https://twitter.com/arpahector) or leave your email on [fullvoting.org](https://fullvoting.org/):

[https://fullvoting.org/](https://fullvoting.org/)

title: Fullvoting
body:
Fullvoting is an idea to combine **direct, representative and augmented voting for DAOs**.

Why?

1. To make better decisions
2. To increase the number of people who can effectively collaborate in decentralized organisations

Many DAOs such as ENS, BitDAO, Decentraland, Proof of Humanity and Uniswap use [Snapshot](http://snapshot.org) for off-chain voting.

These DAOs choose one or more [voting strategies](https://docs.snapshot.org/strategies/what-is-a-strategy) on Snapshot.

A voting strategy on Snapshot that would enable direct+representative+augmented voting would allow eth addresses to delegate to a URL. E.g. my-voting-provider.com/user

Then, the js code of the strategy would fetch something like my-voting-provider.com/user/space/proposal to know a vote.

These voting URLs would have no authentication. Anyone could see on my-voting-provider.com/USER/space/proposal would see the vote of the representative USER.

These URL voting providers are composable.

For example, provider1.com/BLUE could delegate to the following list:

1. provider1.com/A
2. provider1.com/B
3. provider2.com/C

In the previous example, provider1 could also let BLUE vote directly.

So if BLUE doesn't vote but A does, BLUE would vote as A regardless of B and C. If BLUE and A don't vote but B does, BLUE would vote as B regardless of C. But if B doesn't vote either, do as C says.

Consider that BLUE, A and B are from the same URL voting provider, but C doesn't. This means that A and B can use delegation list + override like BLUE. But C, the last delegate from BLUE, is on a completely different provider.

This other URL voting provider could allow C to delegate to a list of all Nobel laureates or MIT neuroscientists. This provider could integrate with Wikidata/Wikipedia to confirm their occupation, alma mater and awards â€” like my old side project [agreelist.org](http://agreelist.org/)

Or this URL voting provider could be a16z which [already delegates half of their voting tokens](https://a16z.com/2021/08/26/open-sourcing-our-token-delegate-program).

Or one of the delegates on the URL voting provider could be AI-assisted or completely autonomous like [CÃ©sar Hidalgoâ€™s augmented democracy TED talk](https://www.ted.com/talks/cesar_hidalgo_a_bold_idea_to_replace_politicians).

To mitigate risks, off-chain delegations could end a few days before direct voting.

And your URL voting provider could end AI-assisted delegates before human delegates.

That way people could always be alerted and override votes from delegates.

To sum up, if we implement direct+representative+augmented voting for DAOs we could:

1. Make better decisions
2. Increase the number of people who can effectively collaborate in decentralized organisations

And this is important because of what the MIT Professor Alex Pentland said:

> *The biggest problem in the world is not climate change, war or poverty, but how we organise among ourselves to make good decisions and carry them out.*

What do you think? Does it make sense? Should we build this?

If you think it is worth exploring, please reach me at [@arpahector](https://twitter.com/arpahector) or leave your email on [fullvoting.org](https://fullvoting.org/):

[https://fullvoting.org/](https://fullvoting.org/)

Originally published on [June 21, 2022](https://twitter.com/arpahector/status/1539179369717022720)

title: Fullvoting
body:
Fullvoting is an idea to combine **direct, representative and augmented voting for DAOs**.

Why?

1. To make better decisions
2. To increase the number of people who can effectively collaborate in decentralized organisations

Many DAOs such as ENS, BitDAO, Decentraland, Proof of Humanity and Uniswap use [Snapshot](http://snapshot.org) for off-chain voting.

These DAOs choose one or more [voting strategies](https://docs.snapshot.org/strategies/what-is-a-strategy) on Snapshot.

A voting strategy on Snapshot that would enable direct+representative+augmented voting would allow eth addresses to delegate to a URL. E.g. my-voting-provider.com/user

Then, the js code of the strategy would fetch something like my-voting-provider.com/user/space/proposal to know a vote.

These voting URLs would have no authentication. Anyone could see on my-voting-provider.com/USER/space/proposal would see the vote of the representative USER.

These URL voting providers are composable.

For example, provider1.com/BLUE could delegate to the following list:

1. provider1.com/A
2. provider1.com/B
3. provider2.com/C

In the previous example, provider1 could also let BLUE vote directly.

So if BLUE doesn't vote but A does, BLUE would vote as A regardless of B and C. If BLUE and A don't vote but B does, BLUE would vote as B regardless of C. But if B doesn't vote either, do as C says.

Consider that BLUE, A and B are from the same URL voting provider, but C doesn't. This means that A and B can use delegation list + override like BLUE. But C, the last delegate from BLUE, is on a completely different provider.

This other URL voting provider could allow C to delegate to a list of all Nobel laureates or MIT neuroscientists. This provider could integrate with Wikidata/Wikipedia to confirm their occupation, alma mater and awards â€” like my old side project [agreelist.org](http://agreelist.org/)

Or this URL voting provider could be a16z â€” who [already delegates half of their voting tokens](https://a16z.com/2021/08/26/open-sourcing-our-token-delegate-program).

Or one of the delegates on the URL voting provider could be AI-assisted or completely autonomous like [CÃ©sar Hidalgoâ€™s augmented democracy TED talk](https://www.ted.com/talks/cesar_hidalgo_a_bold_idea_to_replace_politicians).

To mitigate risks, off-chain delegations could end a few days before direct voting.

And your URL voting provider could end AI-assisted delegates before human delegates.

That way people could always be alerted and override votes from delegates.

To sum up, if we implement direct+representative+augmented voting for DAOs we could:

1. Make better decisions
2. Increase the number of people who can effectively collaborate in decentralized organisations

And this is important because of what the MIT Professor Alex Pentland said:

> *The biggest problem in the world is not climate change, war or poverty, but how we organise among ourselves to make good decisions and carry them out.*

What do you think? Does it make sense? Should we build this?

If you think it is worth exploring, please reach me at [@arpahector](https://twitter.com/arpahector) or leave your email on [fullvoting.org](https://fullvoting.org/):

[https://fullvoting.org/](https://fullvoting.org/)

title: Fullvoting
body:
Fullvoting is an idea to combine **direct, representative and augmented voting for DAOs**.

Why?

1. To make better decisions
2. To increase the number of people who can effectively collaborate in decentralized organisations

Many DAOs such as ENS, BitDAO, Decentraland, Proof of Humanity and Uniswap use [Snapshot](http://snapshot.org) for off-chain voting.

These DAOs choose one or more [voting strategies](https://docs.snapshot.org/strategies/what-is-a-strategy) on Snapshot.

A voting strategy on Snapshot that would enable direct+representative+augmented voting would allow eth addresses to delegate to a URL. E.g. my-voting-provider.com/user

Then, the js code of the strategy would fetch something like my-voting-provider.com/user/space/proposal to know a vote.

These voting URLs would have no authentication. Anyone could see on my-voting-provider.com/USER/space/proposal would see the vote of the representative USER.

These URL voting providers are composable.

For example, provider1.com/BLUE could delegate to the following list:

1. provider1.com/A
2. provider1.com/B
3. provider2.com/C

In the previous example, provider1 could also let BLUE vote directly.

So if BLUE doesn't vote but A does, BLUE would vote as A regardless of B and C. If BLUE and A don't vote but B does, BLUE would vote as B regardless of C. But if B doesn't vote either, do as C says.

Consider that BLUE, A and B are from the same URL voting provider, but C doesn't. This means that A and B can use delegation list + override like BLUE. But C, the last delegate from BLUE, is on a completely different provider.

This other URL voting provider could allow C to delegate to a list of all Nobel laureates or MIT neuroscientists. This provider could integrate with Wikidata/Wikipedia to confirm their occupation, alma mater and awards â€” like my old side project [agreelist.org](http://agreelist.org/)

Or this URL voting provider could be a16z â€” who [already delegates half of their voting tokens](https://a16z.com/2021/08/26/open-sourcing-our-token-delegate-program).

Or one of the delegates on the URL voting provider could be AI-assisted or completely autonomous like [CÃ©sar Hidalgoâ€™s augmented democracy TED talk](https://www.ted.com/talks/cesar_hidalgo_a_bold_idea_to_replace_politicians).

To mitigate risks, off-chain delegations could end a few days before direct voting.

And your URL voting provider could end AI-assisted delegates before human delegates.

That way people could always be alerted and override votes from delegates.

To sum up, if we implement direct+representative+augmented voting for DAOs we could:

1. Make better decisions
2. Increase the number of people who can effectively collaborate in decentralized organisations

And this is important because of what the MIT Professor Alex Pentland said:

> *The biggest problem in the world is not climate change, war or poverty, but how we organise among ourselves to make good decisions and carry them out.*

What do you think? Does it make sense? Should we build this?

If you think it is worth exploring, please reach me at [@arpahector](https://twitter.com/arpahector) or leave your email on [fullvoting.org](https://fullvoting.org/):

[https://fullvoting.org/](https://fullvoting.org/)

Originally published on [June 21, 2022](https://twitter.com/arpahector/status/1539179369717022720)

title: WISxCORE S1 FAQs
body:
## How much can I mint an SBT?

Free.

Minting gas on testnet will also be free.

In the future, only gas fees will be charged on the mainnet.

## Can I use SBT to play games?

Yes, you can.

But you still need an activation code.

And the efficiency of the game will be much lower than using NFTs.

## How can I mint my SBT?

SBT minting is currently only possible using the WIS App.

## Can I choose the image I like?

The algorithm generates a unique avatar image for each address.

If you don't like the default generated avatar, you can generate a new avatar by consuming invitation points.

## Can the avatar be modified after casting it into SBT?

Use invitation points to get alternative avatars before mint.

However, after an avatar mint becomes an SBT, it cannot be modified.

## How to get invitation points?

Invite your friends, when one of your friends' certification level exceeds level 0, you can get 1 invitation point.

## Where will my SBT be stored?

Since Core Testnet has not been launched yet, we currently mint SBTs on BTCs Testnet.

[https://scan.test.btcs.network/address/0xcd60875b1b986717d49cbb285b5817ec7d95bc5f](https://scan.test.btcs.network/address/0xcd60875b1b986717d49cbb285b5817ec7d95bc5f)

## Why can't I see the contract source code now?

Currently BTCs Testnet does not support API submission of source code.

But our open source SBT contract code can be viewed on the BSC network.

Open source code can also be seen in Core Mainnet in the future.

[https://bscscan.com/address/0x09F56eBee86ffCBeC572996f7d66A9ec2c1A3308](https://bscscan.com/address/0x09F56eBee86ffCBeC572996f7d66A9ec2c1A3308)

## Does my SBT still exist after a Core Testnet update?

Yes.

No gas fees to migrate to the new testnet.

## Does my SBT still exist after the Core Mainnet goes live?

Yes.

But migrating to the mainnet requires gas fees.

## How can I sell my SBT?

SBT is soul bound, you cannot sell or transfer it.

## Can SBT be converted into NFT?

No.
But we are designing a way to get NFT with probability by using SBT.

## Is this the official cooperation between WIS team and CORE DAO?

No, this is the first season of SBTs produced with â¤ï¸ by the WIS team for the CORE DAO community.

This is an important test for SBTs and multi-chain supported features.

title: SpacePi Web3.0 2022 Global Hackathon Recruitment Order
body:
The SpacePi Web3.0 2022 Global Hackathon is hosted by the blockchain service provider platform - SpacePi. It is a grand event dedicated to blockchain enthusiasts. This event is expected to create a platform for blockchain developers to create innovative, user-friendly projects suitable for public life, and jointly build the future of Web 3.0. Participants will have the opportunity to receive investment and industry guidance from venture capital institutions, and receive a total of $100,000 in rewards and more than $1 million in incubation seed funds!

This event will be held online. Since June 28, SpacePi's first hackathon will officially open user registration. During the hackathon, there is a super-strong team of mentors who personally guide and escort developers to develop projects and solve problems. Developers will have the opportunity to present their work to entrants, judges and investment institutions around the world to gain exposure for their projects.

The winning team can not only share up to $100,000 in SpacePi, but also receive $1 million in angel investment funds from SpacePi joint investment institutions, financing guidance, and opportunities to connect with multiple media, communities, top VC institutions and other resources.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/diwhd8pVQKs7NGojIMo9s.png?height=675&width=1200)

ã€SpacePi Hackathon Scheduleã€‘
This year's hackathon has three stages: Registration, Preliminary Review and Finals.

1\.Registration 

June 28-July 14: Contestants sign up and form teams freely in the community

2\.Preliminary Review 

July 15-July 31: The participating teams will submit the project preliminary review information one after another

July 31 (before 24:00 on the same day): Deadline to submit project preliminary review information

August 1-August 3: Preliminary review by the judges

Evening of August 3: Announcement of finalists

3\.Finals 

August 8: Hackathon Final Opening Ceremony 

August 20 : Project DEMO demonstration + award ceremony

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/L2hTqC-l59WKm8enOBEwq.png?height=1003&width=1600)

ã€Hackathon Bonusã€‘
Competition Awards:
First prize: $30,000 equivalent to 1 SpacePi
Second Prize: $20,000 equivalent to 2 SpacePi
Third Prize: $10,000 equivalent to 3 SpacePi
More special awards: more details will be announced later

SpacePi Web3.0 2022 Global Hackathon Welfare: SpacePi Awards; additional rewards and opportunities; financial support from leading investment institutions; well-known mentors and technical experts personally guide participants to develop projects and solve practical problems; speech opportunities around the world ; Learning resources and more!

ã€Title of the Competitionã€‘

Web3.0 has come! What is Web3.0? The Internet is still in the Web 2.0 stage. Web 3.0 is the design and vision of the next-generation Internet. It is a broad set of movements and protocols launched to make the Internet more decentralized, verifiable, and secure. Its vision is to realize a serverless, decentralized Internet, an Internet where users control their own identity, data, and destiny.

In the exploration towards the Web3.0 world, many exciting new things have been born. Multi-chain Dapp, Metaverse, and DAO are making the future a reality step by step. Join now to create the future!

Multi-chain Dapp
Public chain, side chain, Layer 2, multi-chain deployment of applications has become a trend; after EVM becomes a standard, it is easy to deploy on the developer side, but it leaves many inconveniences for users: switching networks, data failure, no corresponding Native token to pay Gas, multi-chain fluidity is broken. It can be seen that there is still a lot of room for the development and design of multi-chain Dapps.

In this Hackathon, you can consider optimizing the user experience of multi-chain Dapps, such as multi-chain gas fee agents, cross-chain information, etc.

Metaverse
A large number of users and labor are pouring into the Metaverse, land transactions and development activities are frequent, the rules of the physical world are removed, and the only bottleneck is imagination.

In the SpacePi Web3.0 Global Hackathon 2022, you can consider being the information panel of Metaverse, building actual scenarios, becoming a developer, and serving Cryptovoxels, Decentraland, The Sandbox and other platforms.

DAO
DAO has become the main form of community organization, and the number is growing rapidly. Correspondingly, DAO needs a complete set of working platforms, covering wallets, collaboration platforms, payment management, decision governance, etc.

In the SpacePi Web3.0 2022 global hackathon, you can make a set of office software for DAO for salary payment, project investment, community management, etc.

ã€Scoring Dimensionã€‘
All entries will be graded on the following dimensions:
Commercial Value (25%)
Whether the problem is solved, whether it has application scenarios, and whether it has potential commercial value;
Innovative (25%)
The works are innovative in conception, break through conventional thinking, break through limitations, and be innovative;
Technical challenges (25%)
The technical solution of the work has certain technical difficulties, or has a new breakthrough in technology;
Work Completion (25%)
How is the work completed, what is the proportion of coding, can be demonstrated, and avoid PPT works;

ã€Entry Requirementsã€‘
Teams or individuals who want to create projects based on blockchain and solve real-world problems;
Teams or individuals who want to get funding, technology, community support and incubation;
Teams or individuals with experience in developing blockchain projects such as Metaverse, NFT, GameFi, etc.;
Teams or individuals who have skills in blockchain development, front-end development, Dapp development, design, operation, business, etc. and are interested in innovation.

ã€Ways of Registrationã€‘

1. Send team or individual CVs to [pi@space-pi.com](mailto:pi@space-pi.com)
2. With Telegram contact information, project ideas, etc.

SpacePi official website: <https://space-pi.com>

ã€Partner/Sponsor Recruitmentã€‘
We welcome various partners and sponsors such as media, developer communities, investment incubators, blockchain projects, and traditional industry enterprises to join us!
Please contact email: [pi@space-pi.com](mailto:pi@space-pi.com) for more details.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/G_6y5bm4CyubAixDBtKeO.png?height=746&width=1280)

We look forward to this hackathon opening a new chapter for SpacePi. Whether you're a geek, a product manager, or a startup team, SpacePi's doors will open for you. Here, you can use your creativity and ideas, play a geeky spirit, challenge yourself, create new applications, and write the future.

This Web3.0 Hackathon is SpacePi's first shot in the Pi network ecosystem, and the SpacePi team is looking forward to all blockchain technology enthusiasts to join.

We aim to bring blockchain to everyone and grow the ecosystem through education and community events such as global hackathons.

title: How to monitor the service in BlockPi Testnet
body:
![](https://gateway.worksoho.com/wechat/me/8ec397c27a9214a0631316888d650443/476b95f40c5b9870df570989d8438524.jpg)

## Preparation

> **Note**:  In this doc, we assume you already know how to operate linux, we based on Ubuntu 20.4 and use the root user to execute, so maybe some step need update on your environment if you are use a different environment.
> You can change all path in this doc according to your own preferences, but please remember to make the same changes in the configuration later

From the [BlockPi official docs](https://testnet-docs.blockpi.io/guide-for-operators/testnet-1/monitoring),  we need some 3rd services to implement the service monitor:

* Prometheus: <https://github.com/prometheus/prometheus>
* Prometheus node_exporter: <https://github.com/prometheus/node_exporter>
* Prometheus alertmanager: [https://github.com/prometheus/alertmanager](https://github.com/prometheus/node_exporter)
* Grafana: <https://github.com/grafana/grafana>

![monitoring architecture](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/mRl3YWtIMJ0t_T52hoDBP.png?height=814&width=1934)

### Install the Prometheus

create `/etc/prometheus` path  for install and configure Prometheus:

```bash
mkdir /etc/prometheus && cd /etc/prometheus/
wget https://github.com/prometheus/prometheus/releases/download/v2.36.2/prometheus-2.36.2.linux-amd64.tar.gz
tar -zxvf prometheus-2.36.2.linux-amd64.tar.gz -C /etc/prometheus/
```

create the `prometheus.yml` in the  `/etc/prometheus`:

```bash
scrape_configs:
  - job_name: 'prometheus'
    scrape_interval: 5s
    static_configs:
      - targets: ['localhost:9090']
```

Run Prometheus from systemd file:

```bash
vim /usr/lib/systemd/system/prometheus.service
```

```bash
[Unit]
Description=https://prometheus.io
[Service]
Restart=on-failure
ExecStart=/etc/prometheus/prometheus/prometheus --config.file=/etc/prometheus/prometheus.yml
[Install]                        
WantedBy=multi-user.target
```

```bash
# reload the service
systemctl daemon-reload
# boot-up
systemctl enable prometheus.service
```

```bash
# start/stop and check the service status
systemctl stop prometheus.service
systemctl start prometheus.service
systemctl status prometheus.service
```

you can check your Prometheus service use `http://ip:9090` on browser, remember open the 9090 port.

![](https://gateway.worksoho.com/wechat/me/8ec397c27a9214a0631316888d650443/c002bf8ddb82f746da9b8bc629ee2cb2.png)

### Install alertmanager

```bash
wget https://github.com/prometheus/alertmanager/releases/download/v0.24.0/alertmanager-0.24.0.linux-amd64.tar.gz &&  tar -zxvf alertmanager-0.24.0.linux-amd64.tar.gz
mv alertmanager-0.24.0.linux-amd64/ alertmanager
```

Run alertmanager from systemd file:

```bash
vim /lib/systemd/system/alertmanager.service
```

```bash
[Unit]
Description=alertmanager System
Documentation=alertmanager System
[Service]
ExecStart=/etc/prometheus/alertmanager/alertmanager --config.file=/etc/prometheus/alertmanager/alertmanager.yml
[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target
```

```bash
# boot-up
systemctl enable alertmanager
# start/stop and check the service status
systemctl start alertmanager
systemctl stop alertmanager
systemctl status alertmanager
```

update the  `prometheus.yml` file, add the `alerting` part:

```bash
alerting:
  alertmanagers:
  - static_configs:
    - targets: ["localhost:9093"]
```

you can check your Alertmanager service use `http://your-ip:9093` on browser, remember open the 9093 port.

![](https://gateway.worksoho.com/wechat/me/8ec397c27a9214a0631316888d650443/490939148e1ba89a245015482805c0ad.png)

### Install the Grafana

Install the Grafana use apt, add the repository for stable releases:

```bash
apt-get install -y apt-transport-https
apt-get install -y software-properties-common wget
wget -q -O - https://packages.grafana.com/gpg.key |  apt-key add -
```

```bash
echo "deb https://packages.grafana.com/oss/deb stable main" |  tee -a /etc/apt/sources.list.d/grafana.list
```

After you add the repository:

```bash
 apt-get update
 apt-get install grafana
```

To start the service and verify that the service has started:

```bash
systemctl daemon-reload
systemctl start grafana-server
systemctl status grafana-server
```

Configure the Grafana server to start at boot:

```bash
systemctl enable grafana-server.service
```

you can check your Grafana use `http://ip:3000` on browser, remember open the 3000 port.

![](https://gateway.worksoho.com/wechat/me/8ec397c27a9214a0631316888d650443/aeaf4638590055e5b767e9e4238a2c25.png)

for more install and configuration info:Â 

* <https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/next/getting-started/build-first-dashboard/>
* <https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/next/setup-grafana/configure-grafana/>

## Monitoring system status

> Basic info from the BlockPi doc: [Monitoring system status](https://testnet-docs.blockpi.io/guide-for-operators/testnet-1/monitoring#monitoring-system-status)

To implement this monitoring, you need install the Prometheus node_exporter service **on the host which you install the HyperNode**, follow these steps:

### Install and Configure the node_exporter

Download and install the node_exporter

```bash
mkdir ~/node_exporter && cd ~/node_exporter
wget https://github.com/prometheus/node_exporter/releases/download/v1.3.1/node_exporter-1.3.1.linux-amd64.tar.gz
tar -zxvf node_exporter-1.3.1.linux-amd64.tar.gz && rm -rf node_exporter-1.3.1.linux-amd64.tar.gz
mv node_exporter-1.3.1.linux-amd64/node_exporter /usr/local/bin/node_exporter
```

Run node_exporter from systemd file:

```bash
vim /etc/systemd/system/node_exporter.service
```

```bash
[Unit]
Description=node_exporter
Documentation=https://prometheus.io/
After=network.target
[Service]
Type=simple
User=root
ExecStart=/usr/local/bin/node_exporter
Restart=on-failure
[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target
```

```bash
# reload the service
systemctl daemon-reload
# boot-up
systemctl enable node_exporter.service
```

```bash
# start/stop service, check the service status
systemctl start node_exporter
systemctl stop node_exporter
systemctl status node_exporter
```

after start the node_exporter, you can check the status use `http://ip:9100/metrics` on browser, remember open the 9100 port.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/asD4m6Jc1XEddjUV1MoYW.png?height=474&width=1474)

now configure the node_exporter in Prometheus service, you need switch to the host which install the Prometheus and edit the configuration file `prometheus.yml`, **change the** `targets` **value to your ip:port**:

```bash
scrape_configs:
  - job_name: 'prometheus'
    scrape_interval: 5s
    static_configs:
      - targets: ['localhost:9090']
  - job_name: 'node'
    scrape_interval: 10s
    static_configs:
      - targets: ['your-ip:9100']
        labels:
          class: system
          name: klaytn
          region: Finland
          service_provider: Hetzner
```

restart Prometheus service

```bash
systemctl restart prometheus.service
```

check it on `http://ip:9090`, open the \[Status-Targets\] menu, if you are configure correct you can see what like this:

![](https://gateway.worksoho.com/wechat/me/8ec397c27a9214a0631316888d650443/9dc1e876659dcfc155d3a1f66e8e2c59.png)

### Import the monitoring data to Grafana

After the Prometheus was configured correct, we can import the data to Grafana and view, follow these steps:

1\.add a Prometheus data source

![](https://gateway.worksoho.com/wechat/me/8ec397c27a9214a0631316888d650443/d25861a4920f256c96efde8dedaf38b3.png)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/fMQ1HhDtoR-ADgrHJO7Bg.png?height=1024&width=3078)

input the Prometheus url:port in the URL field.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/EegbFTtpBMnnXNlWwHU0q.png?height=1378&width=1752)

2\.Import the dashboard configuration from the url: <https://grafana.com/grafana/dashboards/1860>, you can find this url in [BlockPi official guide](https://testnet-docs.blockpi.io/guide-for-operators/testnet-1/monitoring#monitoring-system-status)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/o6Vud__X0iZv6cTXzRJbp.png?height=1006&width=1652)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Usil0ZZ0KnKbWLGX-Pn4S.png?height=1236&width=1678)

click the **Load** button, enter the next step, and modify the Name according to your own preferences

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/NShNPvs48FO1-cXnenZpF.png?height=1444&width=1864)

3\.after successful import, enter the `node` in the \[Job\] input field, **which must corresponds to the value of job_name in the** `prometheus.yml` **configuration file**, if it's successful, you can this:Â 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/f3zUP9X9tnZJ5fFYq7prl.png?height=1262&width=2992)

## Monitoring HyperNode status

> Basic info from the BlockPi doc: [Monitoring HyperNode status](https://testnet-docs.blockpi.io/guide-for-operators/testnet-1/monitoring#monitoring-hypernode-status)

The steps here are basically similar to Monitoring system status, so instead of going into detail, here are the main steps.

### Configure the Prometheus

add the monitoring job to `prometheus.yml`, **change the** `targets` value to your ip:port, then restart service (remember the `class` value, you need it in the alertmanager part).

``` bash
 - job_name: 'hypernode'
    scrape_interval: 10s
    static_configs:
      - targets: ['your-ip:8899']
        labels:
          class: HyperNode
          name: hypernode-1
          region: Finland
          service_provider: Hetzner
```

### Configure the Grafana

1\.import the dashboard configuration from the json file, you can find this file in [BlockPi official guide](https://testnet-docs.blockpi.io/guide-for-operators/testnet-1/monitoring#monitoring-hypernode-status) or [click here direct](https://2808964508-files.gitbook.io/\~/files/v0/b/gitbook-x-prod.appspot.com/o/spaces%2Fxax1tyVa6K2eFj1R2Tb8%2Fuploads%2Fwj7pOmjhqIXIBa4i7GpU%2FHyperNode.txt?alt=media&token=c4cfd5e2-f91a-4ea5-9c01-809ee4bc8dbf)

![](https://gateway.worksoho.com/wechat/me/8ec397c27a9214a0631316888d650443/971c4b2389e94a66c4ea95e9c40a1d48.png)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ylJofCk6GDmoKemytYVLJ.png?height=1280&width=1698)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/WZEmXIXneX5emkVa7tPMU.png?height=1054&width=1486)

2\.after successful import, modify the variables in Dashboard, change the datasource to Prometheus.Â 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/u3Qae-2lUpOEkEGlND60X.png?height=982&width=1896)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/SWfR6ajg_Z6wOkuttXDSC.png?height=1376&width=2170)

3\.change the query in the view

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Xt3ObjenVXwInbPjqRADs.png?height=832&width=1514)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/yo1_owrsFyAzRruVQrjVH.png?height=784&width=1628)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/_Du5y54R3f7Sb2h3e3DaY.png?height=684&width=2346)

input the query parameters in `Metrics browser` field:Â 

```sql
increase(grpc_server_started_total{class="$class", grpc_method="ServerReflectionInfo", job="$job", instance="$node"}[1m])
```

4\.repeat the above steps to modify another view

![](https://gateway.worksoho.com/wechat/me/8ec397c27a9214a0631316888d650443/b24e8ee371d9c672e68383ad5dca424c.png)

```sql
go_goroutines{class="$class", job="$job", instance="$node"}
```

![](https://gateway.worksoho.com/wechat/me/8ec397c27a9214a0631316888d650443/32ec1597004793a53e45f4720658fc86.png)

### Add alert use alertmanager

#### add alert rule

update the  `prometheus.yml` file, add the `rule_files` part:

```bash
rule_files:
  - /etc/prometheus/rules/*.rules
```

then add a `hyper.rules` file in `/etc/prometheus/rules/ `, you can get the content from BlockPi official doc: [click here](https://testnet-docs.blockpi.io/guide-for-operators/testnet-1/monitoring#monitoring-hypernode-status).
**but you need change the** `class` value same to the `class` value in  `prometheus.yml` file

![](https://gateway.worksoho.com/wechat/me/8ec397c27a9214a0631316888d650443/1bba2ffc03cdb789e754d5aa80de89cd.png)

 **restart the prometheus service**, you can check it on Prometheus page.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/YyHk3C7En3n_uzfjsqcJD.png?height=1112&width=3078)

#### receive alert use Slack

you need to register a Slack and add a group and channel for alert.

add a App in the channel detail, follow these steps:

![](https://gateway.worksoho.com/wechat/me/8ec397c27a9214a0631316888d650443/cc39e72929066901dd4e28a63fef5a87.png)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/qCy5avPsiONFwORozciP-.png?height=1012&width=1366)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/sgzQMpKvQD595Iz9M6Qqs.png?height=862&width=2036)

after you add it, you can get a Webhook url.

update the alertmanager configuration file `alertmanager.yml` in `/etc/prometheus/alertmanager`, **change the \`api_url\` to your slack webhook url**.

```bash
route:
  group_by: ['alertname']
  group_wait: 30s
  group_interval: 1m
  repeat_interval: 30m
  receiver: 'my-slack'
receivers:
  - name: 'my-slack'
    slack_configs:
      - send_resolved: true
        api_url: your-slack-hook
        channel: '#blockpi-alert'
```

**restart the alertmanager service**, now you can get alert by Slack if your service was down.

![](https://gateway.worksoho.com/wechat/me/8ec397c27a9214a0631316888d650443/27483223a62d6f092b1c82016f84303c.png)

## Monitoring Klaytn Endpoint Node status

> Basic info from the BlockPi doc: [Monitoring Klaytn Endpoint Node status](https://testnet-docs.blockpi.io/guide-for-operators/testnet-1/monitoring#monitoring-klaytn-endpoint-node-status)

The steps here are basically similar to Monitoring HyperNode status, so instead of going into detail, here are the main steps.

### Configure the Prometheus

add the monitoring job to `prometheus.yml` and restart service (remember the `class` value, you need it in the alertmanager part).

```bash
- job_name: 'klaytn'
    scrape_interval: 10s
    static_configs:
      - targets: ['your-ip:31275']
        labels:
          class: klaytn-rpc-node
          name: klaytn-rpc-node-1
          region: Finland
          service_provider: Hetzner
```

![](https://gateway.worksoho.com/wechat/me/8ec397c27a9214a0631316888d650443/4c55438c59bebee283a44029c4f2c053.png)

### Configure the Grafana

1\.import the dashboard configuration from the json file, you can find this file in [BlockPi official guide](https://testnet-docs.blockpi.io/guide-for-operators/testnet-1/monitoring#monitoring-klaytn-endpoint-node-status) or [click here direct](https://2808964508-files.gitbook.io/\~/files/v0/b/gitbook-x-prod.appspot.com/o/spaces%2Fxax1tyVa6K2eFj1R2Tb8%2Fuploads%2Fkb7wCBSqELl0Lc7xq4zy%2Fklaytn_Endpoint.txt?alt=media&token=658aba67-d750-45c4-8a72-90a71645a16d)

![](https://gateway.worksoho.com/wechat/me/8ec397c27a9214a0631316888d650443/7ffc80a29f4a591803600720ecb6f05a.png)

2\.after successful import, modify the variables in Dashboard, change the datasource to Prometheus, reference HyperNode part

3\.change the query in the view,

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/d6TXMHyPoFQ2lVAxDRGUz.png?height=1108&width=2244)

![](https://gateway.worksoho.com/wechat/me/8ec397c27a9214a0631316888d650443/3ebb0065a9b78ee35eb9ffd6353399f4.png)

input the query parameters in \`Metrics browser\` field:Â 

```sql
up{job="$job"}
```

change to another view, update the `Format` and `Instant`, the query parameters: 

```sql
klaytn_blockchain_head_blocknumber{class="$class"}
```

![](https://gateway.worksoho.com/wechat/me/8ec397c27a9214a0631316888d650443/0f3e82f2aebffaf206378c14af96dae9.png)

change to another view, update the `Format` and `Instant`, the query parameters: 

```sql
process_virtual_memory_bytes{job="$job", class="$class"}/1024/1024/1024
```

![](https://gateway.worksoho.com/wechat/me/8ec397c27a9214a0631316888d650443/43d04f8d1c6e1e31ab40e0fcd038ccbe.png)

the finall view:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3_UJpRRZsMQndXN2HGvoE.png?height=888&width=2560)

### Add alert use alertmanager

the steps is similar to Monitoring HyperNode status, you nedd add a `klaytn.rules` file in `/etc/prometheus/rules/ `, you can get the content from BlockPi official doc: [click here](https://testnet-docs.blockpi.io/guide-for-operators/testnet-1/monitoring#monitoring-klaytn-endpoint-node-status).
**but you need change the** `class` value same to the `class` value in  `prometheus.yml` file as in the Klaytn part

![](https://gateway.worksoho.com/wechat/me/8ec397c27a9214a0631316888d650443/6bc452f3bd43c79eb5fe7137d784bbac.png)

after added, restart the Prometheus service.

that's all ,enjoy yourself !

title: Buddha girl with AK47 | My time in Portugal
body:
They call me buddha girl with an AK47 in Aveiro.

One moment I sit there working and meditating, calm and in peace.

Next minute I unleash my inner wilderness, dancing and singing like nobody is watching.Â 

Five months of living in Aveiro is serendipitous and surreal to me. Tourists often consider here a Portuguese Venice for its canals, traditional boats (moliceiro) and unique natural landscapes.Â 

But to me, I consider Aveiro as the salt city, as most locals do, because my grandfather was born in Salt City (ç›åŸ, Yan Cheng) in China. And watching the sunset at the Aveiro salt pans is one of my favourite activities, and I felt a subtle connection with the name and sentimental sense.Â 

My story with Aveiro started with a random encounter in Madeira. I met a Chinese digital nomad in Madeira who introduced me to using [Workaway](https://www.workaway.info/invite/2F813766) to find my next destination. I registered, browsed around, and found [VIC Aveiro Art House](https://www.aveiroartshouse.com/) stand out from other places for its multiple functionalities as the art centre, guest house and label brand.Â 

I messaged the owner and art director, Hugo Branco. Soon, I received his email to find someone with my skill set and professional background to help them with marketing and communications. So I made my trip to Aveiro, a place I had never heard about.Â 

When I arrived at this historical Art House, I noticed two Maori mascots at the doorâ€™s entry. As a Chinese Kiwi, I hardly find any NZ elements in Portugal. The feeling of seeing something connected with home was elastic! After all, itâ€™s been over three years since I left Aotearoa.

Hugo explained that his grandfather [Vasco Branco](https://www.aveiroartshouse.com/vasco-branco/) was involved in various arts, especially in ceramic, painting, cinema and literature, winning numerous awards worldwide, including a couple of trophies from the New Zealand Film Association.Â 

Vasco Branco, a prolific polymath artist, was honoured as a legend in Aveiro. If you walk along the streets and lanes here, you can find many ceramic installations and art projects he left that became beautiful landmarks in this city.Â 

Talking with Hugo about his grandfather reminded me of my grandpa Qi Kaimin, a scholar and artist from China. Both our grandfathers made achievements in arts and literature and suffered from Alzheimerâ€™s disease in their late years. Another connection between Aveiro and me that I didnâ€™t expect.

When I arrived, an Argentina musician Santi Lesca also landed to help Hugo with the upcoming music projects. Hugo took us to tour around a house, and I was amazed by this legacy house his grandfather left for him â€” a gallery, secret cinema, art studio, guest houses and countless art pieces from corner to corner.Â 

While walking around the house, I kept thinking about my grandpa, who left many books, poems and memories to my family, guided me through my life, and set up the foundation of my roots. I miss him so much, and I understand Hugoâ€™s vision to develop this house in his grandfatherâ€™s name.

Not long after Santi and I settled down, we started to plan the [VAGA Festival](https://lifeisavicnic.com/vaga2021/), the first unclassifiable music festival in Portugal. Working with Santi was blissful because his energy and devotion to music and life constantly impacted me. His knowledge of [Yi Jing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/I_Ching) and [Dao De Jing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tao_Te_Ching) impressed me the most. He made a music installation that combined Yi Jingâ€™s philosophy with the Dart Game to tell oracles, which was super successful at the music festival.Â 

Santiâ€™s Argentina background brought me back to a miracle time while I was travelling in Buenos Aires. Back then, I was in a toxic relationship and tired of my corporate job. I didnâ€™t realise how depressed I was until my body broke down with a panic attack. I escaped to Argentina to learn Tango dance under the influence of Wong Kar-waiâ€™s movie, [Happy Together](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5VPvFaAWX9U) and [Tim Ferrissâ€™ story](https://tim.blog/2007/03/30/how-to-live-like-a-rock-star-or-tango-star-in-buenos-aires/) about his Argentina life.

When I connected my mind and body with intense and emotional dancing moves, I started to get a clear vision to save my life. I broke up with my boyfriend when I returned from Argentina and felt the urge to leave New Zealand to pursue my literature dream.Â 

It took me another ten months to quit my fat-salary job in the corporate finance world. Once I got enough savings to prepare for my upcoming uncertain life, I left immediately. I could still taste the freedom of the moment I jumped out of the successful life with a stable job and a beautiful place to live. So I purchased a one-way ticket to London.Â 

However, my new life didnâ€™t go as planned due to the global pandemic, but it rewarded me with a large chunk of solitude. Since I lived near Hyde Park, I had the lifestyle of Henry David Thoreau in Walden, walking, writing, and living with nature as a daily routine.

Living in a foreign country as a newcomer during a pandemic sounds challenging. Still, I followed my interest to visit writers, poets and artist residencies, watched a couple of football games live in stadiums, and published [one memoir](https://www.camelliayang.com/profile.html) and [novella](https://www.camelliayang.com/blog/the-invisible-third-culture-adult-is-out-now) during the lockdown.Â 

After living in [England](https://www.camelliayang.com/blog/goodbye-gb) for more than two years, my itchy foot led me to go on the road again and started to seek my next destination. Portugal popped into my mind becauseÂ 

1\) itâ€™s the first choice of the digital nomad;\
2\) my favourite writer Fernando Pessoaâ€™s home country;Â \
3\) my birthday was the exact date when Macao returned from Portugal to China (a subtle connection between my Chinese root and Portugal);Â \
4\) one of my online friends I admired mentioned heâ€™d move there soon.Â 

So, thatâ€™s how everything started, and I ended up in Portugal.Â 

Training with Madeira Fitness Friends, attending regular Purple Friday at the digital nomad village, hiking between two peaks, swimming in the Atlantic sea, embracing the first sunrise of 2022 on a boat, experience a profound psychedelic trip in the forest, celebrating Christmas and birthday with Portuguese friends, dealing with countless paperwork with SEF, and finally having a base in [Lisbon](https://www.camelliayang.com/blog/lisbon).Â 

Now Iâ€™m [settling](https://camelliayang.notion.site/eb029bdcad4644e28fb38efe5f48269f?v=ea86f226f7b64b6bae81f3d909851bd6) in Portugal, though I have no idea how long this settle-down will last with my serious commitment issue. I want to listen to my therapistâ€™s suggestion to forget about all my backup options, behave like this is the only country I can stay in, and try to attend regular meet-ups with a fixed group of people to deepen my relationships. Never quit or escape because of stupid reasons like the road is dirty, Iâ€™m moving away, or this friend uses an odd perfume, I donâ€™t want to talk to her anymore etc.Â Â 

Here I am, waiting for a flight to Madeira to revisit those lovely people I encountered on this magical island. I started to realise once I reached out to a certain point to experience the width of life, now itâ€™s time to dig deep into the length of human relationships.Â 

As a person with thousands of masks, including contradicted identities like [buddha girl](https://www.camelliayang.com/blog/flowism-my-philosophy-of-living) and [Chinese snipper](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cC7X7BLQIy8), Iâ€™m still on the road to exploring my identity and finding a group of soulmate-ish friends to walk the journey together.Â 

Portugal treats me well with its open-minded and friendly environment and gains the power to attract digital nomads and remote workers worldwide. Iâ€™m here to stay, to create, to stick around with friends and if Iâ€™m lucky enough, maybe form a family.Â 

This is not a typical giving-tips post of a digital nomad living in a foreign country but an honest reflection on my journey to settling down here. And last but not least, as a retired ex-food/travel blogger, I do have tips to share to make your Portugal life more colourful. Enjoy!Â

*   [CY Madeira Tips](https://goo.gl/maps/zeaZoKUtU6xx95TL7)
*   [CY Aveiro Tips](https://goo.gl/maps/mDirrQhS2FKCRkgf8)

title: SpacePi Web3.0 2022 Global Hackathon Recruitment Order
body:
The SpacePi Web3.0 2022 Global Hackathon is hosted by the blockchain service provider platform - SpacePi. It is a grand event dedicated to blockchain enthusiasts. This event is expected to create a platform for blockchain developers to create innovative, user-friendly projects suitable for public life, and jointly build the future of Web 3.0. Participants will have the opportunity to receive investment and industry guidance from venture capital institutions, and receive a total of $100,000 in rewards and more than $1 million in incubation seed funds!

This event will be held online. Since June 28, SpacePi's first hackathon will officially open user registration. During the hackathon, there is a super-strong team of mentors who personally guide and escort developers to develop projects and solve problems. Developers will have the opportunity to present their work to entrants, judges and investment institutions around the world to gain exposure for their projects.

The winning team can not only share up to $100,000 in SpacePi, but also receive $1 million in angel investment funds from SpacePi joint investment institutions, financing guidance, and opportunities to connect with multiple media, communities, top VC institutions and other resources.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/diwhd8pVQKs7NGojIMo9s.png?height=675&width=1200)

ã€SpacePi Hackathon Scheduleã€‘
This year's hackathon has three stages: Registration, Preliminary Review and Finals.

1\.Registration

June 28-July 14: Contestants sign up and form teams freely in the community

2\.Preliminary Review

July 15-July 31: The participating teams will submit the project preliminary review information one after another

July 31 (before 24:00 on the same day): Deadline to submit project preliminary review information

August 1-August 3: Preliminary review by the judges

Evening of August 3: Announcement of finalists

3\.Finals

August 8: Hackathon Final Opening Ceremony

August 20 : Project DEMO demonstration + award ceremony

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/L2hTqC-l59WKm8enOBEwq.png?height=1003&width=1600)

ã€Hackathon Bonusã€‘  
 Competition Awards:  
 First prize: $30,000 SpacePi  
 Second Prize: $20,000 SpacePi  
 Third Prize: $10,000 SpacePi  
  
 More special awards: more details will be announced later

SpacePi Web3.0 2022 Global Hackathon Welfare: SpacePi Awards; additional rewards and opportunities; financial support from leading investment institutions; well-known mentors and technical experts personally guide participants to develop projects and solve practical problems; speech opportunities around the world ; Learning resources and more!

ã€Title of the Competitionã€‘

Web3.0 has come! What is Web3.0? The Internet is still in the Web 2.0 stage. Web 3.0 is the design and vision of the next-generation Internet. It is a broad set of movements and protocols launched to make the Internet more decentralized, verifiable, and secure. Its vision is to realize a serverless, decentralized Internet, an Internet where users control their own identity, data, and destiny.

In the exploration towards the Web3.0 world, many exciting new things have been born. Multi-chain Dapp, Metaverse, and DAO are making the future a reality step by step. Join now to create the future!

Multi-chain Dapp
Public chain, side chain, Layer 2, multi-chain deployment of applications has become a trend; after EVM becomes a standard, it is easy to deploy on the developer side, but it leaves many inconveniences for users: switching networks, data failure, no corresponding Native token to pay Gas, multi-chain fluidity is broken. It can be seen that there is still a lot of room for the development and design of multi-chain Dapps.

In this Hackathon, you can consider optimizing the user experience of multi-chain Dapps, such as multi-chain gas fee agents, cross-chain information, etc.

Metaverse
A large number of users and labor are pouring into the Metaverse, land transactions and development activities are frequent, the rules of the physical world are removed, and the only bottleneck is imagination.

In the SpacePi Web3.0 Global Hackathon 2022, you can consider being the information panel of Metaverse, building actual scenarios, becoming a developer, and serving Cryptovoxels, Decentraland, The Sandbox and other platforms.

DAO
DAO has become the main form of community organization, and the number is growing rapidly. Correspondingly, DAO needs a complete set of working platforms, covering wallets, collaboration platforms, payment management, decision governance, etc.

In the SpacePi Web3.0 2022 global hackathon, you can make a set of office software for DAO for salary payment, project investment, community management, etc.

ã€Scoring Dimensionã€‘
All entries will be graded on the following dimensions:
Commercial Value (25%)
Whether the problem is solved, whether it has application scenarios, and whether it has potential commercial value;
Innovative (25%)
The works are innovative in conception, break through conventional thinking, break through limitations, and be innovative;
Technical challenges (25%)
The technical solution of the work has certain technical difficulties, or has a new breakthrough in technology;
Work Completion (25%)
How is the work completed, what is the proportion of coding, can be demonstrated, and avoid PPT works;

ã€Entry Requirementsã€‘
Teams or individuals who want to create projects based on blockchain and solve real-world problems;
Teams or individuals who want to get funding, technology, community support and incubation;
Teams or individuals with experience in developing blockchain projects such as Metaverse, NFT, GameFi, etc.;
Teams or individuals who have skills in blockchain development, front-end development, Dapp development, design, operation, business, etc. and are interested in innovation.

ã€Ways of Registrationã€‘

1. Send team or individual CVs to [pi@space-pi.com](mailto:pi@space-pi.com)
2. With Telegram contact information, project ideas, etc.

SpacePi official website: <https://space-pi.com>

ã€Partner/Sponsor Recruitmentã€‘
We welcome various partners and sponsors such as media, developer communities, investment incubators, blockchain projects, and traditional industry enterprises to join us!
Please contact email: [pi@space-pi.com](mailto:pi@space-pi.com) for more details.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/G_6y5bm4CyubAixDBtKeO.png?height=746&width=1280)

We look forward to this hackathon opening a new chapter for SpacePi. Whether you're a geek, a product manager, or a startup team, SpacePi's doors will open for you. Here, you can use your creativity and ideas, play a geeky spirit, challenge yourself, create new applications, and write the future.

This Web3.0 Hackathon is SpacePi's first shot in the Pi network ecosystem, and the SpacePi team is looking forward to all blockchain technology enthusiasts to join.

We aim to bring blockchain to everyone and grow the ecosystem through education and community events such as global hackathons.
